Reviews.Title: “Excellent little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kclarkson78
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel for the cost. It's located 100 yards or so by the south exit of Place Monge Metro Station and is easy walking distance of Cardinal Limone Metro as well. The hotel rooms are a average size for this price mark but they are very clean and there is minibar in the room which is a fridge so you can store a few of your own items in there. The hotel is walking distance from the Pantheon and also a couple of mini supermarkets. The staff in the hotel are great and are very helpful. The hotel has Wifi which is charged at 2.50 EUR a day. The speed is good and we were able to video-call (FaceTime) our daughter via the connection. If there is one criticism I have is there is no coffee/tea making facilities in the room - but this is not a huge deal as there are ample places (including the hotel) where you can buy a coffee or a bite to eat. All-in-all a true little gem of a hotel with friendly staff in a good location - at a reasonable price - what more could you ask for!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: pymac
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few nights in October 2011 and found the hotel clean, comfortable and the staff welcoming and very pleasant. It’s only a couple of minutes from Rue Mouffetard and the heart of the Latin Quarter with all its restaurants and markets. You can also take in many sites if you care to walk into central Paris which is only a 20 minute walk. We had a room overlooking Rue Monge with large full size windows opening onto the street letting the sounds of Paris into the room during the day but excellently soundproofed keeping the noise out at night. As others have said the rooms are small, shower cubicle very small and no tea/coffee making facilities in the room but all in all an excellent hotel in a really good location for the Latin Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in handy location would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireDistantsun
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights last week and found the hotel clean, staff friendly and courteous and easy to find! Simple to get to from gare du nord, just one change on the metro - were there in just over 20 mins. Short walk to the heart of the latin quarter which we loved. Small room but perfectly functionable and yes shower cubicle was small but fine and great shower. On a main road but we found the soundproofing was good and we slept well, even has air con on in march! We got a great deal booking on hotels.com and i would definitely stay here again - only 10 mins walk from notre dame and so handy for metro.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel near Notre Dame”
Reviews.Author: Laura M
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 2 night stay in Paris and stayed at the hotel Acte V just off of the Latin Quarter. The location is no more than a 2 minute walk from the Place Monge Metro (you can see the hotel across the road as you come out of the metro) and therefore is very accessible from whatever airport/location you are arriving from. The Rue Monge street that the hotel is located on has some good bakeries (passtieres even...) as well as fairy decent supermarket that is open most nights till 10pm I felt the street was very safe and never had one concern about the area. As others have said the Rue Mouffard eating district is just behind Rue Monge and their are plenty of pleasant restaurants charging no more than 22 euros for a 3 course meal. Notre Dame is a short 10-15 min walk away and is recommended as we passed some amazing bakeries on the way that sold delicious "Pan au Nutellas" for just over a euro! The hotel is charming, red walls, dim lit and felt very Parisian. The staff who I dealt with were all very pleasant and helpful and spoke fluent English. The lift as others have said is tiny, fits no more than 2 slim people, but I thought it was a hoot squeezing into it with the skinny husband and a carrier bag from the shops! Our double room was on the 4th floor, spotlessly clean, slightly dated furniture but had everything we needed. Double bed, desk, flat screen tv (no english speaking channels) and mini bar. It also had a charming balcony style window that looked onto Rue Mouffard however even though we stayed during a weekend we heard nothing from the street when the window was closed. The bathroom was tiny, as was the shower, definately wouldn't fit two, I didn't bother trying! But again had everything one would need including toliteries and was cleaned to perfection every day. The only negative I have is that when the neighbours in the next room went to have a shower or use the bathroom, it sounded like they were in our room, the walls are obviously very thin although I found it quite funny towards the end. This was my first trip back to Paris as an adult and I fell in love with it, I plan on going back at every opportunity I can and would stay at this hotel again if I could get it for a similar cost as I did for this trip (£150 for 2 nights).

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, excellent value for money,”
Reviews.Author: amandypandy
Reviews.Content: For the price, I couldn't find much fault with with this hotel. Excellent location, close to metro and attractions - safe neighbourhood. Rooms small, but exceptionally clean, comfortable beds and not noisy considering it is central Paris. Staff are friendly and helpful (they let me check in early as I was ill). I would stay here again and recommend to others. Only negative would be the very hard pillows!

Reviews.Title: “Ideally situated”
Reviews.Author: ElainePJ
Reviews.Content: the room was a little small but very clean and the staff where so friendly and helpful the hotel was situated in the latin quarter between 2 metro stations and a short walk from Notre Dam Catherdral. many reseraunts in the area and not expensive e.g. 39 euros for two three course meal and a half carafe of wine excellent value. I would definatley stay again at this hotel and we are next spring

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in a great neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Katie L
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 6 days at the beginning of February (during "le grand froid") and it really is as excellent as the other reviewers are saying. The hotel had been recently renovated and we got upgraded to a great room at the back of the hotel overlooking the Arenes des Luteces. The staff is really pleasant and helpful. There is a great breakfast in the morning. The lift is really small but you really only need it twice to get in and out with your suitcases. The stairs are right there. The neighbourhood is great too. On an earlier trip, we had stayed up in the 9th which felt a bit touristy. This felt like a safe, interesting, local neighbourhood with lots of history. The hotel is right between two metro stops so getting around is no problem. If you are taking the RER in from CDG, it's probably best to get off at the St. Michel stop and walk a bit further (about ten minutes) to avoid extra stairs and transfers. The only "drawbacks" are that the room we were in had no safe (the one at the front desk is only accessible during the day), the bathroom is a sit-down shower (which is pretty normal for France) and it's a hotel that asks you to give your key when you leave the room. You're supposed to pay for wireless and printing, but we didn't have to. The room has a mini-bar which we used as a fridge for our groceries and there were extra comforters in the closet. I found a really good deal on Expedia and the room was less than half the listed price. If you're travelling during low season, I suggest checking on those types of booking websites. This hotel is immaculate, recently renovated, has a friendly, accommodating staff and is in my favourite arrondisement in Paris. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kerryp1982
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our quick trip to Paris from the UK,We stayed for 2 nights in total. On arrival, we had a pleasant check-in experience, with no issues with English. The rooms is a little big small compared to some places that we've stayed in previously - but nothing too bad. The bathroom was clean and towels were fresh and it included some toiletries as well. The bed was OK - but maybe a bit too hard and only 1 set of pillows was a bit unusual. The staff were friendly and could speak good English. The lift is a little squashy (my wife and I only just fit in there and we're not big people) - but the stairs were OK to use anyway. The metro is literally right underneath - so only a quick stroll to there. The only negative thing I could say was that as our room faced the road, it was a little noisy during the day / peak hour - but after that time - no problems at all. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and reasonably priced option”
Reviews.Author: leech_family
Reviews.Content: Acte V is very close to the Place Morge metro station on the south (left) bank. Well located for restaurants, Luxembourg gardens and general walking around soaking up Paris street amibience. I have stayed a couple of times recently on business, finding rooms under £100 a night on Expedia - very reasonable by Paris standards. Rooms are very small - of course - as are the ensuite facilities. Breakfast priced at a reasonable €12.50. Nice friendly staff and a clean place. Popular with French visitors which is always a good sign. Recommend Louis Vins as a great local restaurant option, also Variations, a bit further out in 13eme but a good find. Quality cuisine at not too "haut" prices.

Reviews.Title: “A very good value for money hotel, in an excellent central location close enough to walk to most things and with a metro stop on”
Reviews.Author: hudson2680
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good central location in the Latin area of the city, it's close enough to walk to many attractions, with cafe, restaurants and shops close by, to venture a bit further and save the legs you have a metro line right on your doorstep and a train line within a 15 walk so perfect! The rooms I think are a good size by paris standards for the cost, they are basic but very clean,it's in a noisy street but the double glazing means you can't hear anything and we didn't find this to be a problem fir us at all. The bathroom is quite small but it does the job! All the staff were very nice and friendly, there is a supermarket scross the steet and as an area we felt very safe wslking around. we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Georg R
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, extremely friendly and helpful staff, exceptional location near the Rue Mouffetard, easy walking distance to Notre Dame, Luxembourg Gardens, Marais. Small but clean room, typical Parisian hotel tiny shower. Good wi-fi reception in rooms. We will definitely stay here again when we come back to Paris. We accidentally took their hotel room key with us when we left - guess we were reluctant to leave! Mailed it back from Arles, so I hope they received it!

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SidandSue
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really excellent. Ideal situation in the Latin Quarter,within walking distance of lots of good restaurants especially on Rue Mouffetard. The metro stations are very close and many Paris highlights are within walking distance The bedroom was a good size, clean and there was very little noise. (not small and noisy as other reports have stated and our bedroom faced the road) There was a nice area to relax and a bar/breakfast area in the reception area The breakfast was very enjoyable with plenty of fruit, cereals, cold meats, cheese and pastries The staff were very friendly and helpful I think one would find it very diufficuylt to find a better hotel for the price

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: DanielleEA
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel on the basis of Trip Advisor reviews, and we were not disappointed: perfect location, very close to 2 metro stations, and within walking distance of many of the main sites in Paris. Very close also to Rue Mouffetard and its nice vibe and restaurants. The room and bathroom were spotless, and the famously small elevator very charming! Our bedroom was facing the back of the hotel, with a view of an amphitheatre, so there was no street noise at all. Like everyone else on this website, we found the young man at the front desk very helpful - he gave us the address of probably the nicest restaurant we experienced on this trip. His lady colleague at the desk on the morning of our departure was equally helpful in finding out about buses. All in all, an excellent choice: we'll be back, and we'll recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Great Location, Decent Price”
Reviews.Author: tiggles002
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I came to Paris for the weekend and we booked this place for a night. It ended up being $169.00. I had never been to Paris and had to call numerous times from the main train station to find my way to the hotel. The gentelman at the front desk was very courteous and patient with me, spelling out all of the stations that I needed. I came a bit early, but my room was ready, which is always appreciated and is a nice surprise. We ended up getting the wifi internet, but weren't actually charged for the service (which is nice). They handed us a piece of paper, but we never had to pay! Anyway, the rooms are decent, very small as what you would expect in Paris. I brought champagne upstairs to the room and the same guy gave me a bucket with ice (free of charge). There is a decent lounge right near the main desk. The hotel has a small lift and stairs to the upstairs (very narrow). It's a relatively small hotel, but it's in a great location. All in all, pretty happy with the stay and the friendliness of the gentleman working the front desk, plus they have a tripadvisor sitcker on the hotel front door, therefore, it must be a great establishment!

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel for those wanting to explore paris!”
Reviews.Author: Clare M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel for 3 nights and have nothing bad to say about it. The room was clean and comfortable and once we worked out how to work the shower (well when reception explained) the facilities were more than we expected. The lift is snug to say the least but this just adds to the hotel's charm. The hotel is located 10-15 minutes walk from notre dame and less than 10 minutes from one of the city's oldest streets. There are two metro stops very close by and plenty of shops and cafes to grab breakfast or lunch. We would also like to thank the reception staff who were very helpful and recommended an excellent restaurant nearby. All in all a great hotel for anyone visiting paris on a budget, we would thoroughly recommend the hotel and already have to friends!

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: drsuess2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the acte v in march with my boyfriend, I loved the hotel the location is perfect for scenery and bang between two metro stations. The staff were so friendly and polite, the night receptionist/bar man (cant remember his name sorry!) he highlighted a map for us telling us the best way to get places were to avoid the tourist traps and even recommended were to eat and drink! lovely little balcony got an amazing view and photos go back in heart beat!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location & very clean rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Hello2me
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Acre V for 3 nights at the start of our European adventure and could not have been more pleased with the hotel location, room size, cleanliness and appearance. I researched for where to stay for a long time and was so happy we selected this hotel after we arrived. I tried to prepare my husband for the room size after reading other reviews and after arriving he said how pleasantly surprised he was. The staff was also so helpful with directions and recommendations. Take advantage of the supermarket across the street for water, soda and snacks. Also make sure to visit the Latin Quarter at night...it's only two streets away. The staff can recommend which restaurants to visit and you'll have an opportunity to take in the local scene. Again, Ihighly recommend this place for the location, cleanliness and value! Have fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value and amazingly friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: CaspiaPam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights on a flying visit to Paris, largely on the basis of the recommendations on this site. The location is perfect, walkable to all the places I like and just 5 minutes from the Seine. The room was a bit small but you t exactly come to Paris to stay in a hotel room do you, plus the bed was incredibly comfortable. For a hotel bang in the middle of the Latin quarter the price was great value and the staff were absolutely faultless, so friendly and helpful. There's a little bar too where they seem happy to stay open until you want to go to bed which is handy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location yet quiet”
Reviews.Author: kuro
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a well placed yet quiet section of the Latin quarter adjacent to an old Roman amphitheatre and about 50 metres from the nearest Place Monge Metro station exit (Line 7). Our room was reasonably small (typical of European 3 star accommodation) but very clean and had wifi access and cable TV. The furnishing was a little dated but that said, are you really traveling to Paris to spend time in your hotel? The rooms are located on the upper floors which are reachable by a small staircase. There is also an elevator however be warned it is very small (it is literally a 1-2 person elevator). We found the area to be a great base of operations. The metro is incredibly easy to get around and the hotel itself is in walking distance to the Pantheon and Notre Dame. The staff (all English speaking) were wonderful and regardless of our request they seemed more than happy to help. We were able to leave our bags with them on the last day and they even called ahead to our new hotel to confirm our arrival time. I didn't check if they provide any breakfast option as there is amazing eating in the Latin Quarter. The Pâtisserie nearest the hotel on the same side of the road (about 40 metres to the left with a green awning as you exit the hotel) made the best pastries I have ever eaten (try the pear tart!) and we did not encounter a bad meal in our 3 days in the area. There is also a small cafe nearby (again on the same side of the road but around the nearest corner) that serves good coffee. I would gladly stay at the Acte V again and will certainly be booking a room the next time I make it to Paris. *Tip* - The nearest and most convenient Metro entrance to Acte V requires you already have a ticket to enter as there are no ticketing machines there. If you didn't buy a multiple day tourist ticket (which you can get from ticketing machines) you will need to walk a further 100 metres down the main road to the main entrance of Place Monge Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel close to Halal food places”
Reviews.Author: R_A_Siddiqui
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to Paris and Hotel Acte V is a good choice, it is located in a nice area (Latin Quarter).The staff is friendly and speaks english as well. The room were neat and tidy,the only downside was it did not catch wifi. The street is full of nice patisserie shops and 1 Carrefour Supermarket and is 2 min. walk to 2 metro stations (Cardinal Lemoine and Place Monge). It is walking distance to Paris Central Mosque which was really good for us. It is also close to a lot of Halal food places offering Moroccan and Lebenese cusuine. I would recommend this hotel for its good location and service, have a good stay. Rahat Ali Siddiqui

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: steverosbots
Reviews.Content: The travelers were a grandfather who had been to Paris many times, and his three teenage grandchildren, first-time visitors. Acte V fit us like a glove, low-key, simple, helpful information, very clean rooms, small but adequate lobby (with a chess board!), in a neighborhood that was far more Parisian than tourist. The Metro is literally a few steps away (but hidden around the corner), and many must-see destinations (e.g. Luxembourg Gardens, Pantheon, Jardin des Plantes) are just a short walk away. Because it left such a great impression on me, my wife and I will be back, without kids, before too long.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: Gary R
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the Saturday morning and the moment we met the gentleman at reception it was a pleasure in every way. The reception man spoke great English and we expected quite rightly to speak French but he was a complete gem. The rooms are well proportioned and our room had a small balcony where the views were great. The rooms were perfect with excellent cleanliness and included good facilities such as air conditioning, TV and mini bar. The ground floor Bar is very relaxing and priced well, plus the ever friendly staff were on hand to give friendly help and guidance whenever you needed it. Breakfast was 12 euros at weekends but was discounted weekdays and it was good quality and have as much as you like making the price realistic. The area is great and feel safe factor. Turn left out of hotel and a few turnings down on the right and you come to Rue Moufftard, well worth a visit for great restaurants and buzzing social area for shops, bars and cafes again all feeling very safe. We are planning to go back to Paris very soon and have no hesitation in booking here again. PS: Spa/Fitness Centre and Swimming Pool we marked as Not Sure as these were not in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ann B
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on TRIPADVISER comments. So while we thought it would be ok, we were very pleasently surprised by how ok this hotel was! My husband&I had a double room (#41), our 2 teenagers had twin on 1st floor. Rooms were a decent size (based on european hotel sizes) and spotlessly clean. The receptionists were v.pleasant, and could speak v.good english. Location was marvellous-10 mins walk to Notre Dame.Two metro stops steps away from front door. Very pleasant/safe street. Cafe's for breakfast minutes walk away. We could leave our suitcasesfor the day in the hotel after checking out. I would happily return to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: bauwens
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights, price EUR 160 two nights, 300 third one, with breakfast. Reservation indicated that a glass of champagne was included at check in. However no one among the staff was aware of that offer. (OK, they gave me the glass...) Anyway, place could be worse, but it's not great. Whenever I can get a room there, I try staying in the Marais rather than in Quartier Latin, at a three star place that's not much better but that is distinctly cheaper. Among other things because I have found it difficult to find a restaurant in the Quartier Latin that's not a horrible tourist trap. Starting to think the same is true for hotels. Incidentally, I could not get the air conditioning to work. I suspect the chiller was off. A staff member came to my room, did the same I had done and claimed it worked, and I believe actually convinced himself it did. But it did not. Summary, I won't return except if booking late, I can't find anything better. It's not horrible, just that one normally should find better value.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Weerobbie
Reviews.Content: Hotel Acte V is located in the Quartier Latin, between two different subway lines (Monge and Cardinal Temoine) and a 15 mins walk from the Seine. It backs onto an ancient Roman colisium (Lutece) which is impressive in its own right. The rooms are very small and basic in amenity but this is normal for downtown boutique hotels. It was a very clean room with a view of the top of Notre Dame. The bathroom was extremely clean. The staff were very helpful with all our questions and happily booked airport transport for us. They even stored one of our suitcases free of charge for four days when we took a side trip to Brussels. They have a lounge that offers breakfast for 15 Euros pp (I recommend going to one of the many cafes nearby for breakfast). There is a free internet terminal in the lobby but it was only 2.50 Euro/24 hrs (on a stop clock sytem) for WiFi in your room. Our only complaint was that the pillows were too soft so it played hell with our backs. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to Paris and the staff at the hotel played a big role. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Decent place, good price, fair location”
Reviews.Author: PHXTrainer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights. Location was a bit further out than what I had hoped but still very close to the center as well as the train station. Lobby was very nice, breakfast parlor was comfortable. The breakfast was decent but unfortunately not included in our rate as I thought. No one bothered to tell us until we left. For 12 Euros pp for breakfast there are much better options. Boulangeries are everywhere and much tastier. The room was small by US standards, about normal for European standards. I have had smaller as well as bigger. The bathroom was obviously added as it was very small, at 6'1 220lbs I literally could not bend down in the shower to pick up the shampoo without opening the curtain and could not lift my arms up even tucked in. The bed was very firm, linens were ok. The front desk service was very nice and cordial and friendly, offering input about directions and suggestions. Some being better than others. The elevator fits two tightly. For the price ~$165/night it was a good deal for the area. Anything nicer will run into almost double. We never spend much time in the room when traveling so being safe and clean are our biggest concerns. The metro stops are very close, if you buy tickets in packs of 10 you can use the closer stairs around the corner, if you dont have a ticket you have to go further up the street to the entrance with ticket sales.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: tcooper24
Reviews.Content: just come back from a two night break in paris. my wife booked this hotel as a suprise for my 50th birthday it was one of them secret hotels. i must say the location was excellent 10 minutes from notre dame and the latin quater. The metro is 100 metres away which is ideal for getting around paris, never waited more than 5 minutes for a train 1.70 euros for a single trip so if you're on a budget with a limited timescale this hotel is well recommended for getting round the city, We booked a a standard room which was small but clean, shower was also very tiny . the staff were also pleasant and helpful my only gripe was on the second night we were unable to get into our room as the lock was broke on the door - it was a bit inconvenient as all our belongings were in there so they moved us to another room till the morning. we had a late flight the next day so we checked out that morning but asked if we could leave our bags behind the reception till later on in the day. it was over 100 degrees that day so when we went to pick up our bags i asked if it was possible if we could just have a quick shower in one of their rooms to freshen up but we were told they were fully booked. personally i dont think they were i just dont think they could be bothered with the inconvenience but in my opinion it should swing both ways. Overall i would recommend this hotel, it was very clean and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great neighborhood, small but clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: TrippyAG
Reviews.Content: Good value-- the rooms are small (no surprise there, it's Paris) but the location is very convenient walking distance to Notre Dame and the Sorbonne. Plenty of restaurants and markets to explore. The big three sites-- Eiffel tower/Arch d'T/Louve are not walking distance, but 2 metro lines are close to the hotel, so you can certainly get out and about with ease. Friendly staff (we're happy to speak English, if you need). Cozy bar-- nice for a cocktail. This hotel is a solid pick for those who plan to explore the city-- it's definitely not a spa or the type of place where I'd want to lounge in the room all day, but it's clean, safe, convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but small”
Reviews.Author: lomalley
Reviews.Content: The location couldn't have been better. The marche right across the street, great restaurants nearby, train station within a block. We took the train right from the airport. The room was very tiny and if you dropped the soap in the shower you had to get out of the shower to pick it up. Tiny bathroom. Although we weren't in the room much, we did enjoy having the window open and having a glass of wine! The people at the front desk could not speak very much english so it was difficult making travel plans. We wanted to go to the Champagne district but when we asked, they just pointed to the guest computer at the reception desk, which was also in French (the keyboard). I would recommend if you just wanted the room as a base. Elevator could barely fit 2 people. We took the stairs. Advertise internet available but it was not.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location; charming neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: RanaFinn
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon, in September 2008; it's been a while, I know.. But I felt that I should still write a few lines about it, as I would definitely recommend it. The room we stayed in was small, but this, for us, was expected in a "continental" hotel, close to the city centre.. However, for us, the small room was nothing compared to the excellent location, and views from our balcony.. We were within walking distance from interesting landmarks, and the neighbourhood itself was quite charming.. If we get a chance to return to Paris, we would definitely try to come back to the Quartier Latin! The only thing is that we now have a baby, and the room we stayed in would be good for a couple only..

Reviews.Title: “Clean, reasonable hotel in good area”
Reviews.Author: SF_on_my_mind
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. Clean and comfortable. Walking distance to Moufftard. The staff is very friendly and accomodating. The location is excellent which is why I stay there. The ony issue one might have is that the showers are Very Small. In fact it takes planning to do so. Apart from that 'small' detail this is my favorite hotel in Paris, and I stay there when ever I go through town. They offer breakfast in the morning, but do not really have a restaurant. No room service either, although you are so close of hundreds of cafes, who would want room service?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for crashing and heading out into the city!”
Reviews.Author: Psychpostgrad
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good value for money in Paris, the staff were excellent and the reception and lobby inviting. The location was great too but still peaceful at night. The only minus for me would be the dated decor of some of the rooms - I think ours was a standard room so think others have been rejuvenated but it wasn't unclean and the bed was really comfortable. I would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location!!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie090
Reviews.Content: The location couldn't be better. walking distance to St Germaine and a 2 minute walk to two different subway lines. (this is a very big deal when touring paris!) The hotel was clean and the staff was helpful. There is free internet in the lobby. We never ate or drank at the hotel because there was an amazing french bakery on the corner and the smell alone brought us there almost every morning. The rooms were on the small side but adequate. Our only complaint was the shower. Although there was good pressure and hot water, there was no place for the showerhead to go...so you had to hold it while you showered. (or you could take a bath) Aside from that, we couldn't have been happier. oh and be prepared for the smallest elevator in the world! (we took the stairs anyway most of the time)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and cosy atmosphere right in the center of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Caballero-Martin
Reviews.Content: Very nicely decorated hotel, excellent service and warm atmosphere in this perfectly located hotel. Lots of interesting places within walking distance. It was very nice to get back to the hotel, have a cup of tea in the bar and be welcome with a nice smile. Thank you the Hotel Acte V staff!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable choice”
Reviews.Author: oxforduser
Reviews.Content: Service is friendly at this hotel located on the edge of the Latin Quarter. Metro station nearby or a 15 min walk to the Seine and Notre Dame area. Rooms are 'compact', fine if you're just using the place to sleep but two people would find it very cramped to move around in. Bathroom is fairly modern but with the smallest possible shower cubicle. Breakfast is limited 'buffet style', fine if included in your rate but cerainly not worth the full 12 Euro advertised charge. WiFi is available but there is a very small charge. Overall this is a reasonable hotel but not the best choice in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: readyforthenextone
Reviews.Content: Clean, comparatively large for a Parisian hotel room, with cheap internet access and helpful staff. Plus, conveniently located to trains and supermarkets. However, ridiculously small shower (needed to use toilet to access shampoo etc) and limited selection of good restaurants in close proximity.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds and clean safe rooms with courteous English speaking staff.”
Reviews.Author: TimHannah2010
Reviews.Content: I was worried about finding an affordable hotel through the internet that was clean, safe, and situated near major transportation lines, but, above all, I was concerned about finding a hotel with a good bed so I would feel well rested on my vacation. This hotel met all of these criteria. Additionally, the hotel staff was super helpful and all spoke some english. The room and bath were small compared to American hotels but we didn't go to Paris to lounge around all day in our rooms. There was a transportation stike when we were in Paris but we managed. Paris was like any other large city in that there were friendly residents offering unsolicited help when it was apparent that we were struggling and there were people that were flat out rude. I would go to Paris again and I would definitely recommend this hotel to a couple on a moderate budget looking for a comfortable place to rest up for another day of adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TraveltimeSydney
Reviews.Content: We paid approx 130EUR per night and found the location great down near the Latin quarter. Was an approx 10min walk up to Notre Dame and then on to Louvre. Rooms are small (and tiny bathroom) but they all are in Paris. The Hotel itself is very nice and the staff very helpful. Great value and I'd definitely stay here again when returning to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value in great location!”
Reviews.Author: artrun02
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 10 days in Paris and we stayed all 10 nights at the Acte V. We were thrilled with the value, the location, the service, size of room, and cleanliness. We got in and immediately the staff was incredibly helpful letting us know that if we have any questions or needed any guidance, that they could assist us. We got up to our room (small lift!) and found the room to be perfect. Obviously, the room is small, but its ample enough for two people, the shower/bathroom were great size and modernized. We had a small balcony with a view to Notre Dame, score!! Every day we left the hotel in the morning and walked around for hours and hours. When we returned our room was spotless. If we had any questions before leaving the hotel, the staff guided us or made a couple calls for us. The hotel was near St. Germain de Pres and near the heart of the Latin Quarter, only a couple blocks from Rue Moufftard (sp?).Incredibly central, walking distance from many spots and 2minute walk to 2 metro stations. Only one night (first or second night) did we hear people late at night (early morning) causing a havoc after leaving the bars. But, with jet lag we fell back asleep. The next day we found out that the heater/AC has a fan setting (we always sleep w/a fan back at home) so that was awesome! We slept like babies the whole trip. The TV had about 35 channels (2 in English). Room also had a mini fridge w/bar. All in all it was amazing. We would totally stay in the same hotel in a heart beat and encourage all to do the same!

Reviews.Title: “lovely boutique hotel in heart of the latin quarter”
Reviews.Author: monkeyelf8472
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for 2 nights in Oct but wished we'd stayed longer. nice enough rooms, great location( 10 mins from notre dame, and 5 mins from a a street absolutely full of bars and restaurants. very helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Great location, 3 star at best.”
Reviews.Author: srb1256
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at this hotel. The location attracted us, as did its relatively reasonable rates. It is on the 'left bank' area closest to the Latin Quarter. It is a commercial streetfront, and only about a 7 minute walk to Notre Dame. Be prepared for over a 50 Euro cab ride from the airport. It is very close to some Metro stops if you know your way. We arrived to find the smallest elevator on the planet earth (not counting the miners in Chile). My 200 pounds plus 70 pound of luggage hardly fit. There is no bellman to help, and the stairs are pretty treacherous. The room, a standard double, was very small, and the bathroom was smaller. The street, a main thoroughfare, was not very noisy and did not interfere with sleep. The beds were comfortable, and the room was clean. The linens and towels were low quality. I kept asking for multiple towels to dry myself. The not included buffet breakfast is not worth the 12 Euro. The coffee, cappuccino and espresso come out of a vending type machine. The croissants were hard and overcooked and the cheeses were commercial individual plastic wrapped portions. We only tried it once and found the many nearby cafe's to be a better choice for similar cost. The good news, I was not charged for the daily internet, phone OR breakfast on checkout, so it came out ok. The front desk is open 24 hours. For a tourist hotel most of the people I encountered could not recommend a restaurant or give great travel assistance. One woman was better than the rest. Overall, you can probably find better places for similar cost.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely neighbourhood on Left Bank - more local than tourist”
Reviews.Author: gmtravellers
Reviews.Content: Great spot to use as home base to visit many of the attractions along the Seine - friendly accomodating staff; Rooms at the back of the hotel offer more quiet from the street noise. Good value for your dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: redshoot
Reviews.Content: Went to Hotel Acte V for my wedding anniversay and had a fantastic stay. The staff are very friendly and helpful, the room was a little small but very clean and we could not fault it. We found the Latin Quarters very reasonably priced, if you crossed the road from the hotel and went up the steps and down a couple of lanes you came to a square with bars and Rue Mouffetardand and lanes with several restaurants which were offering three course meals from between 16 to 24 euros. The drinks was fairly reasonable especially in happy hour. I would definately recommend this hotel and the area as it is easy to get to everywhere in Paris from here. If you do your research, as some people obviously haven't. you will find reasonable prices and have a great inexpensive time in Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “Small but Friendly”
Reviews.Author: vincec
Reviews.Content: This hotel in the latin quarter is small but friendly. Small rooms and the smallest lift in the world and the friendlist receptionist I have met in a while. It is well located for the Notre Dame area or the Luxembourg gardens. We liked it. Paris was fun and the race day at the "Arc" well worth going and great value. However it has to be said that for Brits Paris is expensive even a long way from the main tourist streets.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Ramsden85
Reviews.Content: Hi All, This hotel is a great hotel. It is small, infact I don't think I have ever seen as small of a lift in my life before, but it had all of the amenities that one required. The rooms were small, as are all rooms in Paris, but the bed was comfy enough, and it laid its purpose. Rue Monge is a nice location for visiting paris. Turn right out of the hotel and walk down the same road for 10 minutes and you will end up right in front of the NotreDam Cathedral. From there, you can access every other destination either by walking up alongside the river, taking a batobus boat (13 Euro per person I think on and off hopping all day), or getting on an open top bus. I warn you it is quite expensive, particularly around the area of the hotel. The Latin Quater afterall is notoriously known for its high rolling recipet books ;) Example, we were paying 11 euros per pint of larger in some areas AFTER happy hour. So tip guys, find happy hour bars!! Paris was awesome, we saw everything, and the hotel, its unique and ellgant tradional way helped me and my partner enjoy our romantic getaway even more. Right at the hotel and a few minutes wlak you come to what must be one of the best pattiseries ever. The pastries there were simply devine! A must try folks.. Any queries at all, don't hesitiate to ask. P.S. I even tried Frog's Legs and Snails! Darren

Reviews.Title: “nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: julieannboo
Reviews.Content: small hotel in a nice non touristy area. reception area was nice. free computer/internet at the counter to use. the lift was tiny - no joke. if you are claustrophic then this hotel isn't for you. it just about fit two of us in plus a case. i thought it was cute though. it an old fashioned lift - you close the door yourself! the rooms were tiny - but very clean. air con was an added bonus. nice hard bed - lovely sheets. fridge with a mini bar - bottle of evain was 2 euros 70. that cheap for Paris! a tea maker would have been nice. had a baconly over looking the main road - that was nice. the shower is tiny - if you are over 5 foot five inches you might have a problem. it leaked once. so don't turn it on full blast or be in there quick. the station is round the corner. there are two exits - i can't remember the name but take the exit that begins with 'A'. Would reccomend this hotel. we stayed there for two nights and it was fine for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...superior rooms are not cramped”
Reviews.Author: harrv
Reviews.Content: We booked a "superior" room (we got room 61), which I believe this hotel calls a "triple" room. Maybe because of that, our bed was large and the bathroom had a full sized bathtub. While I wouldn't say that the room was roomy, we didn't feel cramped. Also, probably because we were on the sixth (top) floor and on the back side of the hotel, it was pretty quiet. We couldn't hear any street noises. The only noise we heard really was the occasional rumble of the metro (which either runs under the hotel or very nearby) and some dripping water noises that seemed to come from the hotel's radiator/heating system. Both of these noises were subtle, and not enough to interrupt our sleep. (The metro stops running at midnight anyway.) The location was very good. The window in our room looked out onto the Arènes de Lutèce. It's an easy walk to Notre Dame, St Chappelle, the Pantheon, and restaurants in the Latin quarter. Metro stations for lines 7 and 10 less than a block away will get you anywhere in the city. Close to bakeries, wine stores, book stores, butchers. Only thing I didn't see on our street that I would have liked was a cheese shop, but I'm sure there must have been one nearby. I would prefer this location to almost any other in the city. The hotel staff is very friendly, polite, and happy to speak English. We had pleasant interactions with everyone we spoke with at the hotel. A few details worth noting. The wifi internet access is 2.50 euros for a full 24-hours of access. Unlike hotels in the states, that doesn't mean a 24-hour period and then it expires--instead, it means that if you use it two hours a night, you can use it for 12 nights before needing to spend another 2.50. So, it is practically free and I'd be surprised if spending 2.50 one time doesn't give you all you need for your stay there. However, only one device can be connected at a time with the username/password they'll give you, so if you want to use both your laptop and your smart phone on wifi at the same time, you'll want to buy TWO username/passwords. That's what I did and it worked great for the whole week we were there. The room comes with a TV, mini bar, hair dryer, shampoo, soap, shower cap, shoe shine wipe, toilet paper, tissues, etc. There is no iron, or ironing board, no coffee maker, no hangers in the closet. The hair dryer unit which hangs on the wall in the bathroom has a place to plug in either 110 volt or 220 volt items, and so I was able to use my electric razor without needing a transformer.

Reviews.Title: “Just a room to sleep in”
Reviews.Author: Najmeh
Reviews.Content: SMALL room though! It was clean--which is not what you can expect in Paris for a three-star hotel. Near St Germain; walking distance to NDP.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Wiseman1154
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to Paris frequently and stayed all over the city. On this trip with my daughter, I decided we should stay in the Latin Quarter for a new experiance. The Acte V hotel is located on the rue Monge which is just off of Saint Germain du Pres. It is a blue collar kind of area where the locals live. There are many restaurents in the area and some excellent bakeries where you can have outstanding croissents and pasteries. The hotel itself is very clean and friendly and draws a crowd from all over Europe and North America. They do speak english and couldn't be friendlier. The elevator is tiny, barely room for two people and their bags. The room we had, #45, had two single beds and was very small, even by Paris standards. The bathroom is tight and the shower narrow, so if you are a larger person, this room is not for you. All that being said, we had a delightful stay here. Is the room worth the $250 Cdn. per night, probably not, but this is Paris, and you pay for location. The Rue Mouffetard is a short walk away (climb the stairs across the street and walk up the small alley and you are there) and it is there you get a real feel of Paris. Narrow cobblestone streets filled with interesting shops, great restaurents, street entertainment, just a great place to hang out. If you want a taste of real Paris, not giant crowds and tourist traps, I would recommend this area and hotel to you. Internet is reliable and just 2.5 Euros for 24 hours, a real bargin in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a cosy little hotel”
Reviews.Author: varanid99
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent - in the Latin quarter, close to some great little restaurants & stores, right near Rue Mouffetard and very close to the Metro. Rooms were (like most places) fairly small, but here they felt cosy, not cramped. Very friendly and helpful staff, and good rates can be had if booked online. We were overlooking the street and expected it to be a lot noisier but we had no problem sleeping at all. Definitely worth a look

Reviews.Title: “niceeee”
Reviews.Author: technosimon
Reviews.Content: paris is expensive but paid £81.00 for this 3 star.near undergound,15 -20mins to notre dame.but only 2 stops on metro.clean & friendly.10 mins to lively latin quarter area.supermarket just down rd.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in rue Monge”
Reviews.Author: up_for_a_bit_with
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hotel Acte V is excellent, a stone’s throw from the metro, walking distance to lots of restaurants, sights and amenities. The double rooms (14 and 15) cost €140 per room, per night, were clean, had comfy beds and were an OK size considering this is Paris. The hotel staff were attentive, helpful and polite and spoke excellent English. Wi-fi Internet cost only €2.50 for 24 hours, although not free, this is still a lot less than some other establishments. However, I am a fairly heavy sleeper, but try as I might the arms of arms of Morpheus would not embrace me. The double glazing proved ineffective against the night long noise from the street, the paper thin walls provided little protection from the sounds of others talking, closing doors, washing and urinating (I thought I had left the tap on). Apparently the “Superior category” rooms at the back of the hotel cost another €15 may be worth considering, but otherwise the hotel comes recommended only to the owners of superior grade earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: innaMontreal
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with a warm, pleasant atmosphere, clean, light rooms, cosy lounge, kind staff and a wonderful location. We stayed for 3 nights and would return happily. Hotel is close to many places of interest, including the main attractions of Latin Quarter, Jardins des Plantes (Botanical Garden), rue Mouffetard (old market street) and right behind it are Arènes de Lutèce (Roman amphitheater from 1st century AD, now a park with a nice playground on other side of Arènes), some rooms have lovely views of them and others face rue Monge, typical Parisian street with many different shops, and the islands de la Cité and St-Louis aren't far. Ours was a large double room on the sixth floor, light and airy with a French touch to the decor and a little balcony. Other rooms looked nice too, I took a peak, even the smaller ones. The AC worked very well and in July we needed it. A computer with Internet, in the reception area, can be used free of charge. Wi-Fi costs 2.50 E per day and a very good calling plan is available: for 2.50 E per day (24 hrs actually) one can make unlimited national and international calls. There is a metro entrance to Place Monge station on rue de Navarre, just steps away, behind the corner, and Cardinal Lemoine station is a block away. Lots of shops, cafés, bakeries in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: liptontee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located near Metro and Notre Dame. It is handy but out of the tourist hub therefore quiet. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are a reasonable size and very clean. We have stayed here for nearly 2 weeks and have loved it here.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: TimSteffy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is as advertised. We enjoyed being near the Rue Mouffetard and the small restaurants and shops nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location & Great Wine (next door!)”
Reviews.Author: vincent_s1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Acte V after reading the reviews here on TA. Really pleased with it overall, value for money was great and service wasn't sacrificed. Rooms were comfortable and clean. Shower was a little cramped but sufficient for the two of us and it was nice and powerful so very refreshing after a days walking and site seeing. Staff were friendly and helpful when it came to giving directions and answering questions. Quick tip, coming out of the hotel take a left and then another left down a side street and there's an entrance to the metro station. If possible recommend getting a room on the top floor; being a Haussman, style building you'll get a nice balcony area that's big enough for two of you to stand on and enjoy a glass of champagne* whilst looking life move by on Paris' streets and Notre Dam in the distance (a pleasant 10 minute walk) If you walk up the stairs opposite the hotel you'll find a shortcut to the Latin Quarters excellent bars and restaurants. The area is great too, lots of nice bakeries, cafes and most impressive was the wine shop immediately next to the hotel. Chap there was great, bought back some excellent bottles... well not all of them *hic* made it back to England!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Place Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: PriscaM
Reviews.Content: The staff was very good and helpfull, giving all the information that we asked. The rooms and the bathrooms are spotless. It has a great location with several metro stations very close by. The breakfast is very good! We had acess to free internet and they also have a very reasonable price telephone package. The only things that did made me choose the rating very good instead of excellent is that the rooms did not have safe (but I must add that the hotel offered it at the front desk).

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Affordable, Great Location. Cant wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: msbout
Reviews.Content: Acte V was an exceptional hotel and one of the best hotel experiences while travelling abroad that we have ever had. The front desk was kind, helpful, informative and always responsible. The hotel was impeccably clean at all times. We enjoyed the daily housekeeping, the comfortable bed, the large tub in our bathroom and the amazing two large window balconys facing the street. The windows were wonderful to keep out the street noise. We also had an AC unit in our room and the hotel has an elevator which are both very important. The location is by far the best part of the hotel. It is located between two main metro lines and the street has everything you need from two Patisseries, a market, several tabacs and close to walk to St. Germains greatest hot spots. I would highly recommend the hotel for all of the above reasons and also the reasonable and affordable prices for their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: Suze123
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 2 night stay at the Hotel Acte V. It's a great location, just a 5 minute walk to the heart of the Latin Quarter, and about a 15 minute walk to Notre Dame. We even walked to the Louvre! The room was small, but functional. Be careful of the porn channel on the TV if you have kids. :) We stayed in the least expensive class of room, but on a high floor. This made the street noise quieter I think. The elevator won't fit more than 2 people (but I don't think that's unusual for Paris). And the shower was indeed the smallest I have ever been in. Might be hard for those with more limited mobility (lots of bending down to the floor to get the shampoo, which was hard in a tight space. We didn't eat their breakfast, but rather we got fruit, breads, and coffees on the street. The staff was friendly and helpful. Overall it was a great hotel and I would totally recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY / GREAT AREA”
Reviews.Author: Ndee
Reviews.Content: Trendy little romantic place in lively area with friendly staff where English was no problem.... We ahd the basic room which was very small BUT that is to be expected ... The tiny balcony (I think every room has a least the tiny one) was great to get some fresh air and look out onto the pretty street ..... You are in a real neighborhood with so much going on during the day... The Metro is steps from the hotel and many parks, gardens, the Cluny, and other Latin Quarter attractions are very walkable.... At night the immediate area around the hotel is quiet as you are a good 10 minute walk to the heart of the Latin Quarter for the nightlife activities.... We walked back to the Hotel at all hours of the night/early am and felt completly fine... Internet note: Wasn't free but at 2.5E/24hours it wasn't a big deal... hope they keep it low or else it wouldnt be as attractive to stay there... For sure the LEFT BANK was a great call.... We had the most wonderful time in PARIS and the Hotel ACTE V was a part of that...

Reviews.Title: “I LOVED this hotel. You will too.”
Reviews.Author: BradfromNewmarket
Reviews.Content: I just can't say enough about this great little hotel. The location on the left bank is great (you WANT to stay on the left bank if you are a tourist). The Metro is just a few steps away from the front door. Services like laundry, a taxi stand, restaurants, convenience stores, currency exchange, and boutiques are just 5-10 minutes away on foot. The neighborhood is very safe to walk around, even at night. The hotel itself is cute, clean, updated, and modern with a great little bar that serves a yummy, basic breakfast every morning and cocktails in the evening. Our room (#55) was immaculately clean, as was the rest of the hotel. The view from our room and window was very nice. The staff is friendly and helpful. I just can't say enough nice things about this great place. If you're thinking of coming here you should be prepared for a very small elevator and a very small shower. If you are a large person, you will not fit in the shower. Opt for a room with a tub and hand-held sprayer instead. If you use a wash cloth, bring your own. Bring your own soap dish too. Next time I am in Paris, I will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very good deal at 99 usd/night”
Reviews.Author: i79
Reviews.Content: good&nice hotel, near to city center (3 metro stops), 1 carrefour ministore and 1 franprix very near. small room(standard 34), good sound isolation from the street, not so good between rooms. very clean, small lcd tv, minibar in the room. nice and safe area around the only small downside: elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Great find and spotlessly clean!”
Reviews.Author: MAV082
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review 6 months after our stay at Acte V but I do feel better late than never. We enjoyed every minute of our 8 day stay in this hotel during Oct 2009. It was impeccably clean which is very important to me. The staff were courteous and friendly at all times. Our room was comfortable and had more than sufficient space. The small shower and lift that many of the reviewers mention, did not bother us at all. Position in the heart of the Latin Quarter is perfect. We could walk to many of the places we wanted to visit and for the rest the metros were only a couple of minutes away. Paris is a magic city and we would hate a visit here to be spoilt by disappointing accommodation. This clean, comfortable and affordable hotel helped make our stay one we will never forget. We will definitely return. Highly recommended !

Reviews.Title: “Quaint little hotel right in the best part of Paris! Value plus”
Reviews.Author: Fender22
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in March after reading favorable reviews on trip advisor. Could not say enough about this lovely hotel right in the middle of the Latin Quarter, right where you want to be! The rooms were excellent although small however this is the norm in Paris. Super clean. The staff were wonderful. Breakfast was incredible as was the surroundings. Super super value at under 100 eur per night. About a minutes walk to Place Monge metro station and 10 minutes walk to Notre Dame. Moufetarte markets just around the corner as are many restaurants. A comfortable warm, quiet and friendly hotel, would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic find in convenient location with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: lmcoley
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from a long weekend in Paris, half work/half holiday, and would highly recommend the Acte V. Perfectly positioned a few steps from the Place Monge métro exit (make sure you take the Arènes de Lutèce exit), the hotel was warm and welcoming from start to finish. Decor is slightly less impressive in the rooms than it is in the lobby and I'd agree with other reviewers that this is definitely the smallest lift I've ever experienced (all part of the fun, squeezing in with large case, small case, camera backpack, handbag and husband!). However, everything was ideal - room was well sized (we were in no. 45) with a suitcase stand, desk, chair, wardrobe and bedside tables; nice view of Rue Monge (very quiet at night); shower was small but well powered and hot; bed was one of the comfiest hotel beds I've slept in with two spare duvets in the wardrobe; and we didn't notice much noise from our neighbouring rooms. We were pretty annoyed that the cigarette smell came straight into our room from the nasty smokers in the room next door, but that was only for a couple of nights. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful with enquiries and internet was just 2E50 for 24 hours of usage (not per day) so that kept us going for the full weekend. All the places we needed to get to were simple to reach - rue Mouffetard with its (over-touristy) bars and restaurants was 5 minutes' stroll (we'd recommend Café Felix for its happy hour 5-euro cocktails), place Maubert for Saturday morning market was 10 minutes walk via the Panthéon, Notre Dame was another 10-minute walk, Louvre was an energetic half-hour march. And of course the two metro stations were just a few steps away. We'd definitely recommend the Petit Cardinal brasserie (on the square near Cardinal Lemoine metro entrance) for eating and drinking in the evening (salade aux gésiers to die for) and the little boulangerie opposite for breakfast pastries and lunchtime baguettes. All in all a great trip and a fantastic find (especially at the special rates we found on Expedia inluding an Air France return flight). We'll definitely stay here next time we're in Paris. Merci beaucoup!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: amondala
Reviews.Content: The service was great. Even though you have to give back the key to the reception every time you leave, there weren't any times when the front desk was closed and we could come and go as we pleased. The airline company lost our luggage on the way over, but the hotel staff would call for us every day to check on it until we got it. This was especially helpful since we only knew a little French and the airline company's English contact wasn't very good at taking down our information. The room is small by American standards, but very cozy, nice, clean, and since we were on the 6th floor, quiet. The bathroom was a bit small and the shower a bit tiny, but it was expected. The elevator is also very tiny, but fits two people in love very cozy. :) The location is close to the Metro and close enough to the Latin Quarter (think young, hip, and nightlife), that we could walk back to the hotel if we somehow couldn't find a Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly helpful staff, great value!”
Reviews.Author: londonloo
Reviews.Content: We spent three wonderful nights here. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean and a decent size, the showers were a little on the small size but it didn't matter! The area is great - very close to metro stations, the Notre Dame and the Natural History Museum are both a short walk away. There are plenty of patisseries close by, Rue Mouffetard has plenty of restaurants and patisseries that are great for breakfast. There is also a market at the Place Monge metro station 3 days a week which is great for cheese and fruit/veg. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Good Service but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Shanshan08
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is excellent with close proximity to 2 x metro, buses and walking distance to all necessary amenities. Rooms were slightly larger than most Parisian hotels and service was great. Helped so much that they could speak fluent English. The only real problem I had with this hotel was noise. As the walls are thin, I could here contant noise from ppl walking to their rooms, doors closing, showers, toilets flushing and even ppl talking in the next room. As I am a light sleeper, this made it very difficult for me to have a totally restful sleep.

Reviews.Title: “really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: valrak
Reviews.Content: very friendly staff, great location, close to subway, very cool neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RareTravelerMaine
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant hotel for decent money (considering Paris prices!). Room comfortable with extra bed for teenager. Helpful staff. Nice bathroom, though it could use (and has space for) a table or shelves to put things on, and it uses the European bath/shower system, meaning there's no holder on the wall for the hand-held shower. Breakfast is overpriced for what you get. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and cleanliness,close to everything by foot, metro or bus”
Reviews.Author: Ceszij
Reviews.Content: We loved the friendly and helpful staff, the excellent cleanliness of the rooms and the absolutely marvellous position of the hotel, in a very pleasant & safe district less than 10 mins walk to Notre Dame and extremely close to 2 different metro stations (line n.7-place Monge & n.10-Cardinal Lemoine) as well as several bus stops. Moreover at less than 5 min walk, on the opposite side of rue Monge (left direction coming out from the hotel, upstairs) you can get to rue Mouffetard, really full of excellent places to eat, have a drink or just walk around in the village-like atmosphere of the latin quartier, without spending too much. Another wonderful area to eat in is the Saint Michel-Harpe-Severin roads, were you can find a similar choice as Mouffetard's, just at 10-15 mins walk from the hotel. There are also several cafes on the hotel street where you can have breakfast spending a little less than in the hotel (12 eur is too much for us!). To sum it up, we were very pleased with the hotel, there was nothing bad about it; maybe just the standard rooms a little too tiny (the superior one was a little more comfortable), as well as the lift; but the pros clearly outnumber the cons, and cleanliness above all was excellent. About the metro stations: n.7 stop (place Monge) is almost 40 m from the hotel entrance but...beware of teh long stairs! We were here with our parents, who are a little aged, and they had some problems with a lot of metro stations because of the little available lifts or escalators. So if you go with your older ones or if you have problems walking, better to take a bus!

Reviews.Title: “Very well placed to see Paris and good restaurants nearby”
Reviews.Author: NorfolkDangle
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after looking at Tripadvisor's reviews. Well placed for all major tourist sites. Very quiet room - needed after all day walking around Paris. Welcoming staff. It was a good job we were advised of the size of the room although it was not as small as we expected. The lift however was very small! Also the shower in the bedroom, although we have stayed in several French hotels and know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: TrishLeeds
Reviews.Content: Staff friendly and made us feel very welcome. Rooms clean and very comfortable. Fantastic location - close to metro and only 10 mins walk from Notre Dame. Plenty of bars and restaurants in the area - safe and friendly atmosphere. Would definitley stay here again and would recommend to others! No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff and extremely clean rooms!”
Reviews.Author: vineenv
Reviews.Content: We had a one week stay here & we thoroughly enjoyed it. Located in the 5th district, very close to 2 stations on 2 different metro lines ensured a smooth travel around the city. The staff was extremely sweet and helpful & the rooms were very tidy and well maintained. the breakfast was a bit expensive though (at 12 euros pax), so we alternated between the hotel and Carrefour (just a min away) :)

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, friendly staff, great location and good value.”
Reviews.Author: billrd
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in Paris at this hotel. It is located in the Latin Quarter and is about 10 minutes walk to Notre Dame. The rooms were older style but clean and everything worked. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Very nice little bar on the ground floor which also serves breakfast. For breakfast we tried some of the numerous little bakeries nearby for delicious pastries and coffee. There are also many bars, bistros and restaurants to choose from in the area. We also discovered several markets in the area which set up in the street or small squares on certain days selling everything from cheese, fruit, meat and fish to clothing, leather goods and jewelery. Because we had HOHO bus passes, our daily routine was to walk to Notre Dame each morning to jump on the bus. We would stop on the way.at a bakery to enjoy a pastry and coffee The location of the hotel was perfect for this. We also had an excellent meal at a little bistro a few doors down the street from the hotel. The Wifi wasn't free in the hotel but was only about 4 euro for a total of 24 hours which was plenty for us. There was also a complimentary PC in the lobby. We had read from previous reviews about the tiny lift, but it was adequate and apparently common in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “very good position in Paris, uncomfortable room”
Reviews.Author: histrion007
Reviews.Content: little bathroom, midrange bedroom expensive breakfast according to the choice very sympathics staff very good situation in the center of Paris

Reviews.Title: “No-Frills, but Charming”
Reviews.Author: dsikula
Reviews.Content: It's a tiny room, but clean and comfortable, so what more do you want? A very friendly staff, who were unfailingly helpful and a great location. Yes, the street noise could be noticeable if the window was open, but once it was shut, it was very quiet. A delightful place that I'd be happy to stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but clean”
Reviews.Author: JassyDigla
Reviews.Content: If you like to get fresh air at night and sleep with the window open, make sure you dont get a room facing the Rue Monge! We didnt at it was very noisy. The reception said that all the room s facing tha back were with bathtubs put apparently they also have a shower in the tub so go for that. If you dont sleep with the windows open it doesent matter since the windows were very good and held the noise out when closed. The rooms were small but nice and clean. The reception area looked newly renovated and the hotel is nicely placed close to two Metro lines and close to the Rue Mouffetard.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjmacdee
Reviews.Content: Acte V is one of the best small hotels I have used in all my trips to Europe. Very clean, the staff is sooo nice and helpful. We arrived at the ungodly hour of 730 AM and they had a room for us. Just wonderful! As with virtually all hotels in Paris, the rooms are small, but ours was a little bigger than what we have had in the past. The bath was roomy, the shower was tiny, if you're a large person you deifnitely want a room with a tub. Very nice towels and soaps. The decor and furnishings were great. The walls were a little thin but it was no problem. The elevator is small but we were on the sixth floor and it was fine. It gets the job done. The lobby pub was very nice and the lobby computer was always available. Overall this is a great location, just a short walk from Notre Dame and the Latin Quarter, lots of good restaurants in the neighborhood, and is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel made our stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: hickeywest
Reviews.Content: This is a really delightful hotel very friendly staff and spotlessly clean, it is in a perfect location and as it was our first visit to Paris it made it a memorable stay. The latin quarter is a fantastic area and is full of lovely restuarants and bars. The only complaint I would have is the rooms are quiet small so dont expect anything big also the bar area is small as well but I think this adds to the charm Kate and Laura 20/10/09

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: CMLAUGUST09
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what we needed. It was very close to the Metro and restaurants/bars. They also had our room ready when we arrived at 9:00am from our overseas flight which was wonderful. Definitely nothing fancy and the elevator is about 3 sq feet. We really enjoyed our stay though!

Reviews.Title: “First Trip to Paris and this hotel was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: LDHolland
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris, our honeymoon. We were more interested in the city and food than our hotels, but were very happy with this hotel. The hotel has a great location in the Latin Quarter, near two metro lines. The rooms were small, but all hotel rooms are small in Paris. The staff was very nice, and helped with any questions we had. We did not have breakfast....no need when there are cafe's and pastery shops all over. It really was perfect for our first time in Paris, we would definitely staff here again!

Reviews.Title: “great location- great hotel, good value with kind and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: gunboat4444
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and really glad we went with this hotel. We had room 41 it was clean , smart and very quiet. If we return to paris we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hotel in the heart of a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Leaudemiel
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Acte V after reading reviews and finding a better price on booking.com than on their site. We had a kingsize bed, and a little balcony. Couldn't see the Notre Dame from the 4th Floor, but no complaints! The hotel was very friendly with English speakers, though as a former French major I used what I could. They even recommended a delightful bistro down the street for dinner. It is also really close to Metro stops so we could get home easily from other sections of town, while also being in the heart of a great neighborhood with food and shops, so you don't have to hit the tousity sites if you don't want to. It also abutted ruins of an arena. Amazing. I would skip the breakfast and go up the street to a cafe to sit outside and watch Parisian life. The hotel is near an EMS station, so there were many sirens. If you keep the windows close, you don't hear them. But we were warm and left them open. We learned. If you are a light sleeper you may want to ask for a back room. The only downside. The elevator is extremely tiny. It says it can home three, but my husband and I were a tight squeeze (and we aren't large people). Perhaps older travelers would need more room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: MonaMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Acte V for 4 nights in June and we couldn't have asked for a better place. The rooms were small but clean and well presented. Bathroom was spacious and clean. Yes the lift is tiny and claustrophobic but its really optional the stairs are fine. The location was perfect. Only minutes away from the metro and close to Rue Mouffetard which had some great places to eat and a lovely atmosphere. The staff were sooooo helpful, answered all of our questions and were friendly at all times. Special mention to Manon who went out of her way to assist us and give us great hints and tips. Overall a wonderful stay, great value and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great value. Great place.”
Reviews.Author: JasonManikel
Reviews.Content: Just back from eight nights in Paris. We spent three of those nights at Hotel Acte V, and stayed at two other hotels in town. This one was probably our favorite overall. Many of the other reviews say it well: The location is really superb. We found the Quartier Latin to be our favorite area of Paris. The hotel is really close to the metro, Place de la Contrescarpe and Rue Moufftard (extremely charming and social spots for cafes and restaurants), and the main sites at the centre of the city (Notre Dame, etc). The hotel offers good value. The place was also cute, friendly and clean. A couple of things it had over our last (more expensive) hotel (Hotel de Sevres): - air conditioning (which in August was pretty nice, I'll tell you!); and - a bath tub (which neither of our other hotels had). The only points we'd count against it: - tiny elevator (though it was kind of charming, in a way); and - a strange, low-mounted shower-head that was unusable unless you were kneeling in the tub.

Reviews.Title: “An enchanting hotel. Perfectly located; welcoming and helpful staff; excellent housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: sldLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this boutique hotel with my son for 3 nights in August. Excellent value for money. Rooms small and bathrooms even smaller - but enchanting and clean. The heart of this little hotel lies in its staff who ALL welcomed us with a smile each time we came and went - and were helpful beyond anything I could have expected. (Although the wifi is not 'free', at E6 for 24 hours it is very inexpensive)

Reviews.Title: “Not a fault to be found - economical, clean, lovely staff and great location.”
Reviews.Author: LandN09
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hotel Acte V for four nights. I booked this hotel because I was looking for a comfortable hotel that was economical. I was pleasantly surprised to find the hotel clean, comfortable, in a great location and with friendly staff. The room was small, and my 16 year old son and I had to share the queen size bed - but this was only a small sacrifice to have such a great home away from home in Paris. It was my first trip to Paris, and when I return I'll be booking into Hotel Acte V again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: scottishblondie
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because the one my boyfriend's parents recommended (next door) was fully booked. Acte V was actually cheaper, and looked just as good on the web. It didn't disappoint. The hotel is in a great location, right around the corner from the Place Monge metro station, and is only a 15 minute stroll from Notre Dame. The Latin Quarter around about is full of nice little restaurants and bars. When we arrived the staff were very friendly, and mostly spoke fluent english. The hotel fronts onto a busy road, but our room was on the back of the building overlooking an amphitheatre type space and was totally quiet. The windows were double glazed so I would assume the rooms at the front would be pretty quite also. Our room was nice and clean, the bed was comfortable and there was also a small chair that looked like it might have folded out into a small single bed (although I didn't look too closely). The bathroom was small but functional, sink, toilet and bath. We had booked a room with a shower (bath was 10 Euros more) but we got a room with bath. It had a tap/shower head mixer which was good for rinsing, but there was nothing to put the shower head into higher up and no shower curtain, which made an actual shower a bit difficult! The room also had an excellent air conditioning unit, which was a blessing, a TV, and a small fridge under the desk. The room itself had plenty of space for 2 people. Overall I would definitely recommend the hotel. The location is great, the staff friendly and the rooms clean, comfy and of a good size. If I go to Paris again I'll definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
