Reviews.Author: ksmn5
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Acte V. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. I really liked the decor, with the patterened curtains and simple white comforter. The bed itself was comfortable (it is a firm mattress, which I didn't think I liked, but I slept so well I'm reconsidering!), as was the pillow, which felt soft and wasn't the hard foam that some hotels use. The bathroom was nice, lots of towels to use and a good size sink with plenty of places to put toiletries. The towels were fluffy and absorbent, not thin. The shower was small, and the only place to put shampoo was on the small ledge in the corner. I think this is typical for Paris, but it's something to be aware of, because it is closer than US showers, and took getting used to, even for me, and I'm a smaller person. A plus-size person, or one who wants a lot of space, might want to consider the rooms with the bath. On the plus side, the water pressure was great, and you could adjust the height and angle of it to suit yourself. There is a lift, but it is tiny! I thought it was great just because of that, but it is not a multiple person and their luggage kind of lift. One person and some luggage, or two people and no luggage! We stayed on the 3rd floor, so didn't use it much, but if we were higher, I think it would have been very useful! Breakfast was plentiful: breads (brioche and baguette), small pastries (which are mini-sized but seemed to come from a bakery, not the kind that come in plastic wrap), yogurt, cereal, juice, cheese and meat and always fresh fruit (bowls, and also whole fruits. I had white donut peaches that were yummy). And of course coffee, tea, hot chocolate, etc... The breakfast is 11 euros, but I think it is worth it, because there is a great deal of variety. I liked to have yogurt, bread with cheese and met, juice and coffee, so it worked out well for me, but if all you want is a pastry and quick cafe, perhaps somewhere else would be better. I liked the convenience and the quality. And I love the red decor! The staff were very helpful. From the cleaning ladies to the concierges, they were great and went above and beyond. They hold the keys when you go out, and as there is always someone on the desk 24 hours, you just pick it up when you return. I like not having to keep track of the key, and I'm sure it's a security measure for them, too. It also means you get to know the concierges a bit, and this adds to the warm feeling of the hotel. The location is convenient: literally around the corner is the place monge metro, and if you feel like walking, it's just a short distance to the Seine and Notre Dame (half a mile; perhaps 10 minutes, tops). We walked just about everywhere, only taking the metro from the hotel to get to places farther afield. Rue mouffetard has lots of restaurants, a fun market, and great people watching. When we return to Paris (someday), we will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: LucyP49
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights from 12th July 2009, the location of the hotel is excellent and within easy walking distance of the lively Place Saint Michel with lots of restaurants and bars. The room size was very small, but adequate, and cleanliness very good. Traffic noise was not a problem even though we were on the street side. Air conditioning was lovely after spending hot days sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: ZorroMontreal_Canada
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights, my daughter and I, and we enjoyed our stay. The room was OK in size, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was very clean, and it was quiet at night, even on street side. The hotel is very well situated: there are 2 metro stations nearby and the lively Place de la Contrescarpe and Rue Mouffetard are only 5 minutes away from the hotel. There is also a Vélib' (bike rental station) on Lacépède Street (2- minute walk) .The area is safe and I would certainly go back to this hotel on a next trip. And the staff was friendly and very helpful. Travelers from Montreal, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: NYonMyMind
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel online after finding out many others were booked. it was meant to be! The hotel is clean, hip, comfortable, and affordable. Great location, less than a minute from the Metro (Place Monge stop on the 7). The rooms facing the street is noisy if you have the windows open, but with the AC on you can keep your windows closed, which cuts down on all the noise. The staff was friendly and helpful. The only potential negative is the small shower stall. Since the stall did not come with a little nook to keep your soap and shampoo, I had to put them on the floor, but it was hard to bend down because the stall was so small. Maybe a room with a bath would be easier. All in all, I highly recommend this hotel. You can't beat the great price!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great people”
Reviews.Author: cschneider05
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. I booked a reservation here based on the reviews on this website, and I could not have been more pleased. The hotel was really cutely decorated and the staff was extremely helpful. Walking distance to the Pantheon and Notre Dame and also close to two metro stations. Rooms were good, a little small, but that was expected. I would definitely stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Top location, clean room, good mattress, safe area & reasonable too!”
Reviews.Author: JimDavidson
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights last week based entirely on recommendations from this site. Excellent value in a great location in the Latin Quarter. Felt very safe walking around, even at night. Easy walking distance from Notre Dame and the river and met stations. Our room was on the first floor overlooking the street. No problems with noise at all, but that may be due to the fact that we were so shattered from walking 12 hours a day! Staff were very friendly and helpful and didn't laugh when I spoke 'french'. Only downside if you can call it that was that the room was very small, as was the bathroom - the shower though was excellent - ooh and the mattress was great too - on the bed, not in the bathroom. Can't comment on the breakfast as we ate out each day - with a boulangerie approx every 100 yards it's a pastry-lovers dream. Save yourself some research hours and stay here, we were really pleased with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Wyn8
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights with a colleague in March 2009. Fantastic location, very comfortable room and bed. Cannot speak too highly of this hotel, it was terrific. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. My room on 6th floor only had a shower, whereas my colleague's room on 4th floor had a bath. One side looks over the street, other side looks over Roman ruins and expansive views. Very quiet at night, central to cafes etc. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Pepromene
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at this nice little affordable hotel which we found via Tripadvisor. We got a room at the first floor which the receptionist apologised for, but as the windows were thick there was no noice from the street. The room was very clean and it was cleaned well every day. The bathroom and the shower were ok, however on the 3rd morning we run out of hot water for some reason. We were so happy with our stay that we didn't lose any sleep over this. There was some noise as well as cigarette smoke coming from the room next to us at times, however the during the night it was always peaceful and smoke-free. The staff was friendly and spoke English as well; we got to borrow a corkscrew and a knife from the reception/bar as we bought some wine, cheese and baguettes from the nearby shops. The location is very good; 100 meters to the Cardinal Lemoine metro station, other metro stations nearby as well, and an easy walking distance to the Notre Dame and river Seine. We felt very safe even during the weekend nights. There are several nice cafes nearby as well as the restaurants at the Latin Quarters.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in the Latin Quarter for the price!”
Reviews.Author: annhill1825
Reviews.Content: My friends and I decided to go to Paris for a week. They booked their room together on Priceline and was given a room at the hotel across the street from Hotel Acte V. I chose Acte V because it was close to their hotel and cheaper. It was the best decision ever. I booked a single room and it was much larger than the room my 2 friends were sharing across the street. The room was clean and the staff kept the entire place perfect the whole time I was there. The staff was so great! This is the best place to stay in the Latin Quarter!

Reviews.Title: “Good Find”
Reviews.Author: d_mcvey
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, 500 yards from Cardinal Lemoine Metro stop, clean hotel, nice reception area , free internet access, bed had pristine white sheets with not any horrible over cover, mattress was fantastic. Near to Mouftarde region come out hotel front door turn left then take second right you are there, lots of restaurants and bars better priced than the St Michell area. Will go back next time in Paris. David & Hazel Kilwinning Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: candi2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and highly recommend it. The room was small but by no means the smallest we stayed in in Europe ! It was nicely decorated and had a good bathroom with shower. We had a room on the 3rd floor overlooking Rue Monge and were prepared for it to be a bit noisy, but the double glazing cut the noise dramatically, so noise was never a problem. The staff were very friendly and helpful and there was a bonus of a laptop with free internet access in the lobby. This hotel is in a great location for walking - in the midst of the Left Bank and just 5 minutes walk down Rue Monge to the Seine. There are plenty of cafes and restaurants in the neighbourhood. The hotel serves breakfast but there are so many other (and cheaper) options close by, we didn't bother. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little hotel”
Reviews.Author: LizardBang
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Acte V hotel for 3 nights and we were very happy with our accommodations. Our room was clean, comfortable, and quiet (we were facing away from Rue Monge). Paul and Ana Claudia at the front desk were very helpful and friendly. The location is great - close to Notre Dame, the Metro stations and to Rue Mouffetard which has lots of restaurants and cafes. I definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: DodieSoCal
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a wonderful 5-night stay at the hotel in mid-October. For the price, you could not ask for a better hotel for the location. We were within walking distance of Notre Dame, Pantheon and yummy Eric Kayser as well as Sunday's street market at Place Monge. We were also one step away from several metro stops that whisked us all over the city. The hotel staff was very pleasant and accommodating. Manon, for our first night, recommended a great little Corsican restaurant called Le Cosi near the Sorbonne, which was a great start to our Parisian culinary adventures. The room itself was on the small side but was to be expected in Paris. We had a room on the 3rd floor facing the street. I would have preferred a room facing the Arenes de Lutece, but one was not available the day we checked in. The double paned windows did help reduce the street noise significantly, however I still had to wear earplugs in order to fall asleep. I travel often and am used to this, but if you are not I recommend specifying a room facing the park if possible. We had breakfast at the hotel once during our stay. 11 euro is really not that bad of a price considering it is a buffet and you would pay at least that much in a cafe. Like another poster, we enjoyed viennoiseries at Eric Kayser down the street. The pain au chocolat will melt in your mouth! It was a great few days in Paris, and we would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Volanges
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Acte V for four nights in mid September. Our room was on the third floor and faced rue Monge. The street is somewhat noisy, I suspect it is a popular thoroughfare because it is a two-way street, but the double-paned windows help muffle out the noise. Moreover, I needed to turn on the a/c to drown out the noise and help me sleep better. Next time I would definitely consider staying at a room on the back of the hotel, which faces the Arenes de Lutece. Everything was impeccably clean. The shower was incredibly narrow, which could be an issue for larger people, but it was fine with us. The reception personnel was friendly and nice. We skipped the hotel's breakfast and instead headed down the street to Eric Kayser for delicious bread and pastries. There is also a well-stocked Champion supermarket one block away, which stays open until 10 p.m. The location is perfect for exploring the Latin Quarter. The hotel is right by a metro station that takes you directly to Les Halles, the Louvre, the Palais Royal, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely charming”
Reviews.Author: shell_81_au
Reviews.Content: After hearing many a horror story regarding evil parisian accommodation I was a little apprehensive about the hotel I had chosen, given that I was not able to spend a considerable amount on my stay. I need not have worried, the Hotel Acte V is quiet, clean and charming. It is not situated in the hustle and bustle of Central Paris, but in the beautiful area surrounding Notre Dame. There are a two MRT stations within walking distance, ample restaruants, the area is clean and you feel safe walking around at night. The rooms are smallish, but by no means small by Paris or London standards, clean and comfortable. The staff are lovely and helpful (even to those whose French extends only to Merci!). For the price, I would sday you h=would have a very difficult time finding a more charming place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: brooklynite011
Reviews.Content: With only two nights to spend in Paris, my fiancé and I wanted an affordable room in the heart of the city. We booked Hotel Acte V on the recommendation of an in-the-know friend, and loved it. The location was perfect: within minutes from must-see tourist spots like Jardin des Plantes and Notre Dame, and just steps from the cafes and restaurants on Rue Mouffetard. Also around the corner from the best croissant in Paris (Maison Keyser), so def. skip the hotel breakfast! Our room was small but clean (only prob was the shower: no shower head or shower curtain, just a modern spigot at the end of a hose) with a lovely view of bustling Rue Monge (thick glass windows meant noise stayed outside). Staff was very sweet. This isn't exactly luxurious, but we found it to be excellent value for the money. The hotel was the ideal launching pad for our explorations of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Comfortable Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: St_LouisMoFFGirl
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed for just one night at ACT V and loved it. We were able to easily walk to great attractions and streets in Paris. The neighborhood itself if cute. The room was small but very comfortable. We did not have the breakfast. I would highly recommend this hotel. It was great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Changed since Julie left!”
Reviews.Author: Clucket
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this extremely convenient hotel in the Rue de Monge during the tenure of Julie I was interested to see what difference the owners had made. Rooms appear to be unaltered but reception and breakfast area now a bordelo crimson red. Believe it is now family run but there was a distinct lack of visible staff apart from the occasional head of someone sitting behind the reception desk. At no time did any member of staff address us or ask if everything was OK. Breakfast overpriced at 11 Euros and totally self service with not a member of staff on hand. Would I stay again - probably, if only for its location to central Paris, restaurants and the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great area for exploring...”
Reviews.Author: shm_ottawa
Reviews.Content: Clean room with great nearby amenities. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on”
Reviews.Author: AJ&ERtravel
Reviews.Content: This is our favourite part of Paris but our first visit to this hotel. The reviews are spot on, it's a lovely, clean hotel very convenient for the metro and the famed latin quarter. The weather was lousy but c'est la vie. Our room on the fifth floor was a good size with a queen size bed. We were much amused by the shower which was hand held and attached on a very short line to the bath tub thus requiring one to climb into the bath and kneel down to use it. If you don't see the funny side of this, make sure you book a room with a stand up shower. We thought the breakfast was excellent but dismayed the staff by pressing both the expresso and cafe au lait buttons on the coffee machine, they thought we were mad. Do walk up the hill to the Place Contrescarpe for a drink and some wonderful people watching. Thank you, Hotel Acte V, a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the experience”
Reviews.Author: CatherineMT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights here in April and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Lovely hotel, staff were very friendly and helpful. We had a garden view room and it was very pleasant and very clean. Room service was good and we had tea delivered to our room each evening. Breakfast was nice and good value at 11 euros each. The only problem was that the shower over the bath was a bit hard to use and tended to flood the bathroom. I would perhaps recommend going for a room with just a shower. The location was excellent as it is near to two Metro stations, Notre Dame and the markets. Lots of coffee shops and restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Acte V OK”
Reviews.Author: marvelmartin
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a two night break to visit the tennis at Roland Garos. This hotel is handily situated close to Cardinal Lemoine metro which is on direct line to RG. Rue Monge is quiet and less touristy than some areas and is close to Rue Mouteffard (up steps opp. hotel and follow your nose, loads of restaurants and cafes.) The very nice Jardin des Plantes is close by too. Our room was Paris smalland bit dreary but with a nicely refitted shower room and excellent double glazing to cut out the excessive traffic noise from the street (successfully). Unfortunately the AC in room 24 only seemed to stir the air around. Staff were efficient friendly and pleasant. Overall Ok but not a lot to shout about.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: wearepsu91
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Paris and can't wait to go back. The hotel is only a 10-15 minute walk from St. Germain Blvd and from Notre Dame. There is a metro spot a short walk in either direction, depending on what line you want to take. The room was clean and updated. We were on the 5th floor facing the street. There was zero noise when the windows were closed, but it was nice to open them and get a breeze and listen to the world go by below us. The staff spoke English well and had whatever we needed (plug converter, ice bucket, knife for cutting cheese). There are a couple of markets nearby at Place Monge and Rue Monteffarte (sp?) that are convenient to pick up food at. There are bakeries all over Paris to get wonderful bread and treats. We ate at the nearby Le Petit Cardinal. It was good and fairly priced. We will definitely return to Hotel Acte V.

Reviews.Title: “Down to Earth Paris”
Reviews.Author: erubMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this recently renovated hotel for 6 nights in early April. Spotlessly clean and everything we wanted - comfortable bed, great location (on top of the Metro station for Place Monge and walking distance to Notre Dame, the Paris Mosque, the Pantheon, and so much more). Our room was on the 4th floor facing the street - double glazing meant cozy warm and also quiet. We paid 125euro (plus taxes) for a room for two people with a bath (although we had only booked a room with a shower). We arrived early from a very long flight and they were very accommodating and let us have our room straight away. I don't know if there is WIFI, but there is a laptop at reception with internet and access to a printer - no charge for printing. Some days we walked, some days we took the metro, we went all over Paris and always found when we'd had enough it was easy to get back home. The room was serviced and all the towels replaced every day. There is a short but reasonably priced room service menu. Breakfast is buffet for 11euro (no need to book, just rock up if you want to) and including cold meats, yoghurt, croissants, etc -- a good deal. Coffee was from a machine, however, and was not so great. Don't miss the market at Place Monge -- it operates Wednesday and Sunday but is better on Sudany. Not so touristy as most and full of actual Parisians doing their shopping. Awesome fruit, cheese, meats, fish, breads and a few stalls also with clothing/crafts. We usually had breakfast at Cafe LeBarnum, which is a short work towards the river up rue Monge and looks scenically at a park, a church and a flower shop and traditional french breakfast (croissant, baguette with butter, juice, and your choice of coffee) for 8 euro. Beware of the tourist traps in nearby rue Mouffetard -- any restaurant which will seat you before 7.30pm is probably chock full of English speaking tourists and the food will be crap!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: KBNYC
Reviews.Content: Hotel Acte V (Residence Monge) on Rue Monge in Latin quarter is a wonderful option for budget accomodations. They delivered exactly what was promised. Exceptionally clean (including daily change of towels and linens) little hotel. We stayed in a room with a double bed (quite comfortable mattress) and a shower. Very courteous service with many employees proficient in English. The location is amazing, close to Rue Mouffetard, Notre-Dame, Pantheon; one to two blocks walking distance to 7 and 10 metro lines; two blocks from the wonderful Place Monge market (three times a week). There are many brasseries and cafes nearby offering breakfasts as well as several boulangeries. Depending on how one looks at it, the small shower and tiny elevator may seem as downsides. However, we found it to be a very European part of experience. We would highly recommend this hotel for young married couples, single people, open-minded middle aged adults. This may be a bit too small and uncomfortable for children and older people.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great area”
Reviews.Author: Family_McLeod
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend this hotel. Stayed for 4 nights with my 8 year old daughter. Perfect location, rooms very clean and fresh, The bath linen was changed every day. The bathroom however is very small so if you are bigger or taller than the average person you may have a problem. This was room 35 but maybe there are other rooms with bigger showers. Well worth asking though as it's really a lovely hotel,especially the lounge and reception. The staff were very helpful and speak good English. Lots of cafes for breakfast in the morning, our favourite was ' le petit ecolier' across the road to the right, which does a lovely omellete with croissants,juice, coffee and bread for less than 8 euros ! Rue mouffetard is beautiful and full of lovely boutiques, crepe shops and very reasonable set price menus of which the food was delicious. Try the little Chinese vendor , 12 euros for a meal for two. Also the cafe bar which sells fantastic crepes and home made hot chocolate. Stay at this hotel, we really had a FAB time !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: fillem
Reviews.Content: Was referred by family member who travels to Paris often, and was thrilled with the hotel. The lovely lady in charge was helpful and spoke pretty good english. The continental breakfast was well worth the price, and the rooms were comfortable, though not exactly spacious. The Hotel is located close to Metro Stations, and taxis are not a problem. I was there with my 10 year old daughter for 10 days, and would definitely return to the Hotel Monge every time I am in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Met our needs and a little more”
Reviews.Author: ehulse
Reviews.Content: This hotel was more like a bed and breakfast. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was small, but nice, very clean. The shower was great and bathroom was clean as well. We overlooked Rue Monge and the street was a bit noisy at night with the window open. Hotel is in a great location, close to train stops and many bakeries. Overall, it met our needs and i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - will come here again”
Reviews.Author: Jaratpan
Reviews.Content: Hotel is less than 5 mins from Place Monge Metro station. Safe neighborhood. 10-15 mins walk to Pantheon, 20 mins to Norte Dame, half an hour to Musee d'Orsay. A few eateries and laundromats on the street. Some shops open late at night. The staff speaks English and very helpful. The room is adequate except there is no coffee making set and we had to sit down for our shower (no problem for the hot bath).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Hotel Monge”
Reviews.Author: aliontheisland
Reviews.Content: I can only add to the great reviews which have preceded this one .. hotel was a wonderful base for our 5 night stay. We had a room on the 1st Floor overlooking the road, there was no disturbance from traffic at all. The room was spotless and the shower hot and powerful. We didn't need anything more. The staff are also excellent. The room was cleaned daily and the reception staff were always on hand 24 hours a day (we arrived late and had to leave very early). I would definately recommend the Hotel Monge to anyone visiting Paris

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Monge!”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler4848
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monge lived up to all the great reviews! The staff are helpful and friendly, and very willing to help. They allowed me to leave my luggage the morning I checked out since my departure was not until that evening. The hotel has a tiny elevator which is just the right size for one person and your luggage. My room was lovely and clean. I found the bathroom to be clean and perfectly adequate. The bed was comfortable and there was a television and a wardrobe to hang clothes up. The breakfast was delightful and I looked forward to it every morning- the croissant and baguette are to die for! Of course this is the case all over Paris. The breakfast also included yogurt, cheese, and coffee/ tea/ hot chocolate. The location of this hotel is perfect. There is every type of shop or restaurant that you might want located right there on rue Monge. There are two patisseries nearby that you should definitely try if you like delicious pastries. If you walk down just a bit to where rue Monge crosses Blvd St. Germain, you will find even more shops, restaurants, etc. This hotel is very close to Notre Dame which is great for sightseeing. Notre Dame is also a great location to get on one of the hop-on, hop-off bus tours. I chose the L'Open Tours but any of the bus tours are a great way to get your bearings and decide what you want to see and do, especially if it is your first time in Paris. I found that the Hotel Monge was the perfect base for exploring Paris, and also had enough comfort to allow me to relax at night and feel at home. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. I love Paris and I would definitely stay here when I return.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: TessJ33
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights at Hotel Residence Monge and would definitely reserve space at this reasonably priced hotel again. We had a room on the fifth floor, looking out over the Arènes de Lutèce. It was wonderfully peaceful, and from our window we could watch kids in the Roman arena kicking soccer balls and guys playing boules. The bed was comfortable, everything was quite clean, the staff very helpful. We made use of the computer off the lobby where guests can check email. The elevator is tiny, but who cares? Rooms have a refrigerator/mini-bar with enough space to chill a bottle of wine, which is nice. There are wonderful shops and restaurants nearby, and three Metro stations. We highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay, Price too High for What you Get - Look Around for better deal!”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeTraveller41
Reviews.Content: As with all "cheaper" Paris hotels the room was small and the shower even smaller (coffin like is how I would describe it!). That is expected. Counter-balacing this is that it had a great location near the metro, lots of food/bars, has a/c in room (that really works) and a mini-fridge which was nice. The staff is friendly, English-speaking (moderate level). Where I think Hotel Monge really comes up short though is with the beds. Our bed was small and HARD HARD HARD. We stayed for quite a while and it really hurt to come home to that after a long day of city trekking. Other things that were annoying was no place in shower to put shampoo (no ledges, etc) and with it being so coffin small it made for some interesting shower olympics to function. Ladies: shaving your legs is nearly impossible. Really. :) The other thing that was especially hard for me was that they had promised us a "non-smoking room" as I am very allergic to cigarrette smoke (I know - it makes Europe a challenge). Once we arrived even though all the doors around us on our floor and above and below ours were marked "No Smoking" the hotel clearly did not enforce this as it was like sleeping in a bar it was so smokey 24/7. When I inquired about this they said that is is not *really* non-smoking. What?!? Sadly, that was the only reason I wanted to stay at this hotel. Otherwise I found the price too high for what was offered. We ended up leaving and stayed someplace else in just as good of a location for 20euro a night cheaper and had better amenities. So, look around there are lots of hotels out there you don't have to overpay.

Reviews.Title: “Would return”
Reviews.Author: ranlykr
Reviews.Content: A great budget accommodation. Julie gave us wonderful recommendations for nearby restaurants (avoid eating near the Eiffel Tower as you will be surrounded by non-so-friendly tourist traps), and the entire staff was very friendly and accommodating. Rooms are small, but this is typical for Paris. If you stay at this hotel, stand on the bed and reach up to touch the ceiling, and you will have an interesting suprise. The ceilings are bouncy, like a balloon, as we discovered by chance. We would definately stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CFCCBT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for three nights in September. The Hotel rooms are small but they are very well maintained. Very clean rooms, bathrooms and toilets. Hotel staff are very friendly and accomodating. Great Location! Reasonably Priced!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but small”
Reviews.Author: kotroskin
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for nine nights in August, the room was small and simple but cozy and very clean and the staff friendly. Overall we were happy with our stay and the price was very reasonable but we have a few small complaints: -the shower was uncomfortably small -the minibar fridge was probably broken since it didn't keep things cool at all, just slightly below room temperature (we tried to change the settings, didn't work) and some beverages in the minibar were past their best before date -the walls are pretty thin, one Saturday night I woke up again and again because of noise from other guests in the hallway coming home after partying... for light sleepers earplugs could be a good idea Great location, great neighbourhood, recommend taking a stroll (or relaxing with a book) in the beautiful gardens nearby (Jardin des Plantes & Jardin du Luxembourg) and walking around the islands in Seine. We highly recommend a restaurant we found on the Saint-Louis island: Le Caveau de l'Isle, good food, service and value.

Reviews.Title: “Well run and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Kelsey07
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for several days in May. This is a fine hotel and a great value. The owner, Julie, is one of the nicest people you will ever meet in France. The hotel is extremely well kept, the rooms are not huge but are large for a two star hotel, and are quite quiet. Some even open on to the Arenes de Lutece, which is also a great spot for a picnic. The hotel is almost directly next to the newly-remodeled Place Monge Metro station. Breakfast is extra and is quite good. The free e-mail terminal in the lobby is also a nice addition. The French call a hotel like this "tres propre," and it sure is.

Reviews.Title: “LIved Up to Everyone's Reviews”
Reviews.Author: FranceAlways
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with my stay at this hotel. Stayed 3 nights and the first 2 nights I couldn't hear anything from the street or hallways. Third night was a bit noisier from the hallway and elevator. Hotel room was fine and it was nice having air conditioning that you could control and having a mini bar. Had breakfast once at the hotel....croissant, baguette, yogurt, cheese and cafe au lait. Pretty good deal, but decided to try other places. Wish the hotel were closer to the action; however, it was near lots of restaurants on Rue Moutefford (sorry, forgot the spelling) and the metro was very close. Recommend this hotel but might choose another one closer to, say, the Champs Elysee next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: stewart52
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed in June and we had an amazing time. We are students on a budget and feared that we would have to settle when it came to our hotel, but we were wrong. The hotel was clean and the area was very safe even in the early hours of the morning. Julie and her staff were very helpful and willing to answer any of the questions that we had. The Monge is great and I will be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “It was great, overall”
Reviews.Author: MDleopardgirl
Reviews.Content: This place was overall wonderful. The room was small, but I was expecting that from others reviews. I think we flooded the bathroom b/c the shower was TINY and the water kept leaking out. We got lucky though because we got a balcony without even having to request it. The hotel was very cute and very boutiquey... for the money, it was about the best you can do! Its in a wonderful locationin the latin quarter, minutes walk from rue St. Germain and there is lots to do, eat, etc. We walked down to the Seine in about 7-10 minutes with numerous bars and restaurants... we were minutes from the Pantheon and Notre Dame. The only complaint that I have is that Julie, the owner is not friendly. There were mixed reviews about her in previous reviews and i had a bad experience. The day I checked in, I had bought an international phone card, while I waited for my friend from London to get there, I wanted to call my mom. When I finally figured how to dial out of the hotel (you press "0"), and I entered the 4 digit "toll-free" number (it wasnt toll free, I was charged for using the phone after being told at the front desk they don't THINK there is a fee to call a toll free number), I didn't know how to dial to the US, in the US when you dial out, you dial 011 +country code.... well there its 00 + country code, but I didn't know that. I went down to the front desk to ask her and she was rude about it and told me i have to dial 0, but that isn't what I was asking her. Then the phone rang and I told her to go ahead and answer and I will wait.... thinking it was a customer wanting to book a room. I ended up standing there for 10 minutes while she chit-chatted with what sounded like a friend. Luckily, my friend whom I was meeting walked in the door at that time and he told me to dial 00 first. Thank god he walked in or I woudl have still been waiting. She didn't even get off the phone long enough to great him either. Honestly, it wasn't that big of deal but I just thought it was rude. Oh and one thing about paris... if you are leaving on a rainy day, leave plenty of time to take the metro and RER to the airport b/c you cannot get a cab anywhere. I asked the lady at the desk on my last day to call a cab and she said she couldn't b/c its raining and they are all being used. I almost missed my flight!?!?!?!!!!! The hotel overall was great and we weren't there all that much so it didn't really matter! The A/C is a great thing too! And its very close to a few metro stops on different lines which made getting around VERY easy!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: TucsonRuth
Reviews.Content: My 13-year-old daughter and I just returned from a 5-night stay at L'Hotel Residence Monge. It was the perfect place for us, in the Latin Quarter and near two Metro stations on different lines. None of the previous recommendations for this hotel was exaggerated. The rooms clean, the staff friendly and efficient, the area safe, and with plenty of Brasseries and other food stores nearby. We felt comfortable exploring the area on foot. Our room, number 21, faced the back garden/area, which I would recommend as there is lots of traffic on Place Monge. We only ate breakfast once at the hotel as there are plenty of other places nearby and cheaper. My daughter loved the little 2-person elevator. The only thing I found annoying was you could hear water draining from nearby bathrooms in other rooms, but mostly we were on outings, so this did not present a big problem. I also must say that Julie and staff really take the time to have window garden flowers, and other nice touches that make this 2-star Paris hotel a gem. I would definitely recommend it to anyone wanting comfortable, but not luxurious accommodations in Paris!! Ruth from Tucson, AZ

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for viewing Paris”
Reviews.Author: ddh309
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything you need at a great price. It is very clean, charming, safe, an excellent location, an outstanding staff in a charming neighborhood with tons of shops and restaurants, including 2 excellent bakeries within a block. Very close to 2 Metro stations and only a 10 minute walk to Notre Dame. This place was cleaner than several American hotels including our last stay at a Disney World hotel. We will stay here again and recommend to anyone. The owner Julie was extremely helpful and made it our home for the week. While the room (and elevator) is not large compared to US hotels, it was just what you need considering what little time you spend in your room. Stay here and save your money for your Paris adventures!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Abazaba
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 week vacation in France. The first week was spent in Paris at the Hotel Monge. Julie, the manager, took excellent care of us while we where there. Our flight arrived before check-in and so we left our bags in the eating area and walked around the area. When we returned, Julie had taken our bags to our room - this was totally unexpected as we weren't staying in a 3 star hotel - plus - there weren't any guys around to do the hauling. The rooms are decorated in French country fare. Our room had a balcony and we enjoyed the views from it. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was clean and very functional. Hotel Monge was very centrally located for us as there is a pharmacy located on the same block (needed because we got chest colds), laundramat, a Champion grocery store and many brassieries and bistros located nearby. It is also steps away from the metro which made it very convenient for us. This was our first time to Paris, but we will definitely stay at the Hotel Monge the next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: moes2228
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monge is not a 3 star hotel, but it is a good value for the price (~100E for a double w/ bathroom) and location. Hotel Monge is situated in the Latin Quarter in between 2 metro stops (on two different metro lines), Cardinal Lemoine or Monge. This hotel is in walking distance of the Pantheon, the Sorbonne, Luxembourg Gardens, Notre Dame, etc. Nothing is right around the corner, but if you came to Paris you are prepared to walk. The first few nights of our stay we were on the 5th floor. There is a small lift (one person + one suitcase) that is available. Internet is available in a small closet off of the lobby. One of the main advantages of the hotel is the manager. She is efficient, effective and kind. There is a safe available at the desk (8pm-8am the safe can't be opened. The safe can't be accessed unless the manager opens it). We did not have breakfast in the hotel, but the breakfast room is quite nice and we would consider it in the future. Also available at the hotel are tour books of Paris in English in case you need more advice on what to see. We did not enjoy the 3 restaraunts we chose in the Latin Quarter, in the future we'd go straight to the Champ Elysses or Eiffel Tower area for dinner as we found the service (English speaking/American compassionate) and quality of food better. Do NOT eat in the Greek area on the river bank (Hotel Monge side of the river) near Notre Dame. The food is horrible unless you want a gyro.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: gfrompisa
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is nice and the breakfast is excellent and you can have it early in the morning (some time can be useful). The room was nice and small (as in most Hotel in Paris). I had an excellent wireless service (free). Something rarely available. Actually I was able to use as if were in my office. The staff was helpful. On the minus side: they do not take Amex. It is a general problem in France. Rue Moffetard is nearby. And it is not the usual street of the Latin quarter. You can see real French people (not upper class bourgeois) and share their experience. The action on the Marais is a walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Americans in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Vailhusker
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our short trip to Paris - what an incredible place! As americans we were concerned about how we might be treated, but had nothing but positive experiences everywhere we went. Hotel Monge was selected after an exhaustive search and we were very happy with our choice. We got a room on the first floor. It was very modest, and a tad dated, but the room was clean and the bed was comfortable. No view from the first floor, but hey, plenty of views can be found elsewhere. The morning breakfast is continental, very satisfying. The location was perfect to venture out. Close to the metro. Walking distance to Notre Dame and the Louvre. If we make it back to Paris, we will no doubt book with the Monge again.

Reviews.Title: “Take me back to Hotel Residence Monge!”
Reviews.Author: Tripfantastic
Reviews.Content: Hotel Residence Monge is always a hit with us. Julie, the manager, and her unpretentious but extremely helpful service, is always a delight. She speaks good English and can be very patient with those of us trying to bludgeon out a few French phrases. Although this is a two star hotel and is not fancy, it is clean, charming, and well-run. The back faces an incredibly delightful field and old roman stadium from another age. The hotel is ideally located and our base for many exciting new ventures, such as having entrecote frites (Relais D'entrecote- found in Tripadvisor, of course) and tasting the best ice cream ever (Bertillon). Run, do not walk, to Isle de Louis, (really the Isle of Ice Cream), to have the Bertillon caramel ice cream. A delightful cafe is at the foot of the street across from the Metro stop where one can read, sit, or just have a delightful Cafe Creme uninterrupted or unhurried. I can't wait for my next trip and to hear the children playing in the courtyard behind Residence Monge. Thank you, Julie, for providing such a haven for those of us who cherish Paris. A Bientot!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monge is a great deal”
Reviews.Author: passepartoutNC
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monge was recommended by a friend and lived up to my expectations. It is comfortable, spotlessly clean and the owner, Julie, is friendly and helpful. The hotel is within easy walking distance of many Left Bank sites and is close to 3 metro stations. It is an ideal base for visiting Paris

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Bargain Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MCaseNC
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews of this hotel here and contacted the property to book our week in Paris. In the past we have stayed at the Hotel Joan of Arc in the Marias and were disappointed to be unable to book there. However, the Hotel Residence Monge, on the Rue Monge, is very lovely and very well maintained, and the staff very friendly and helpful. This was an excellent choice. The hotel is located steps away from a Metro station (1/2 block) and is within 3 - 5 blocks of two other stations. The rooms are small but practical and comfortable and many of the rooms are equipped with American style showers (which are again very small). The property is centrally located and all of Paris is easily accessible, although there is quite a lot to do in this neighborhood. We were very pleased with this lovely hotel and would not hesitate to stay there again or recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “at the monge again”
Reviews.Author: golfidian
Reviews.Content: Exactly half a year after our first stay in the Hotel Monge we stayed here again for 4 nights. After reading some of the very negative reviews here I was slightly worried if hte positive impression we had had mabye changed. But no; we enjoyed the time there as much as before. The room was extremely clean, enough space for 3 people, the location just always again is simply perfect for buying food, going for walks (Jardin de plantes!) or simply wathcing people. So I still highly recommend this Hotel for people who don´t want to spend too much money but want to have a nice, clean and friendly stay in a lovely area of Paris!

Reviews.Title: “What A Find”
Reviews.Author: harplute
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a week in Paris. My stay was excellent, thanks in good part to the Hotel Monge and its staff. The hotel is conveniently located near 2 metro lines in the 5eme arrondissement, the Latin Quarter. There is a Chapion supermarket down the street and lots of restaurants, fast food outlets and pastry shops nearby. The hotel itself was very clean and the staff were most helpful. They speak English well and are kind and professional. There is a computer in the lobby and it is free for the guests to use. I emailed home every day. Breakfast is extra, but it was a good value; it includes cafe au lait, tea or cocoa, yogourt, cheeses, jams, butter, croissants and bagettes. The cafe au lait was very good. Our room was on the 6th floor. No worries, there is a very small but dependable elevator. The room was a good size and had a private bathroom. The shower was forceful and there was plenty of hot water. The maid did an excellent job cleaning, and even folded my granddaughter's PJs which she left under her pillow one night. The room had a mini fridge and a TV. The one shortcoming was the fact that there was no safe in the room and no safe at the reception desk. I was assured by the owner/manager, Julie, that it was safe to leave things in the room. I put our passports, travelers' cheques, and US cash in my suitcase and locked it with a small lock. Everything was just fine. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for good rates at a clean, friendly hotel in a safe, convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in Paris!!!”
Reviews.Author: debnem16
Reviews.Content: Thanks to reviews I had read here on TripAdvisor, I selected Hotel Monge for my trip to Paris with my sister and my 10 year old daughter. I so apologize for the delay in writing this review, but, however late, I'm certain thing are the same as when were were there last June/July. Everyone raved about Julie! Julie! Julie is a truly friendly, fluent in English, proprietor of the Hotel Monge and is why you should choose to stay here during your Paris stay. She is so much more than that, as she also was extremely helpful when we needed directions to somewhere. She had a file of maps printed out and would simply reach for the appropriate map, take her yellow highlighter, and show us exactly how to get from point A to point B. She also was wonderful at recommending the most incredible places to eat- family friendly and reasonable, with A+ food (And as a former food services instructor, I am highly critical and picky when it comes to food!). By the time we left, which had been 7 days, we felt that we had made a friend, and I thank her profusely for making our stay there the best! This adorable little hotel is in excellent proximity to 3 metro entrances, and is an easy walk to Notre Dame. The hotel is not for those of you who are looking for 5 star amenities, but it is CLEAN, and SAFE, and comfortable. You have control of your heat/cooling through your own thermostat, our bathroon was large by European standards with great water pressure and big fluffy towels. (We had a triple) There was adequate rooms for us and our luggage. A small TV but we never even turned it on! (Who goes to Paris to watch TV?). We had a nice sized balcony that looked out onto the Rue Monge, and with the 2 French doors closed, it was very quiet, and we all slept well. There is an elevator with enough room for you and your suitcase- I mean ONE person. WIthout suitcases, three of us were able to travel up to our room. Julie serves breakfast in a sweet little room adjacent to the lobby, and although we heard it was tasty, we opted for walking across the street to our choice of bakeries where we loved the pan au chocolat and other French delicacies that we could eat while we walked to out morning destination. Although I have the resources to stay almost any other place in Paris, I will head back to Hotel Residence Monge on my next trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: DeeWBee
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to the Hotel Monge (it's on rue Monge in the heart of the Latin Quarter). On previous Paris visits we had stayed at a very satisfactory 2-star hotel in the 6th district but recently they had become much pricier with no commensurate benefits so off we went to the Monge. We were able to check in early (other Parisian hotels we've stayed at are very rigid about not letting the room until the posted check-in hour) and this was a welcome convenience. The elevator is tiny and the rooms are smallish but everything was neat, clean, tidy and pleasant. Bed was comfy, bathroom fine, everything worked and functioned as hoped. There are two Metro stops within a block's walk, plenty of reasonable restaurants, it's a short walk to the famous rue Mouffetard and Pantheon as well as the Luxembourg Gardens and the Saint Germain area. Behind the hotel itself is the ancient Arene de Lutece, once used by the early Parigi as a colesium and now a public park with vestiges of the original arena still in evidence. All this for 86 euros per night for a double room! Will we be back? What do you think?!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monge delivers!”
Reviews.Author: tb_74
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Monge last summer, and as it was my first trip to Paris, I wanted to make sure we were in a decent hotel. The Monge is a very nice property, very clean, very well located (only five minutes walk to 2 different Metro lines) but very basic. The rooms are small, the bathroom is minute (particularly the shower) and the elevator is just large enough for two people on low-carb diets. However, I must reiterate how CLEAN the hotel is, and how helpful the staff is. Be sure to take advantage of the free internet access in the lobby to check flights, book tours etc. While at the Monge, be sure to explore the neighbourhood, you'll find some amazing places to eat and beautiful for strolling around in the evenings. One of our favorite activities was to hit a local pasta takeout restaurant and bring it back to the Arena behind the hotel. Nothing like enjoying a fresh pasta dinner sitting under the Paris sky watching children kicking a ball around. The hotel is also close enough to walk to the Notre Dame (where we usually started our adventures for the day); you can make it there in 10 or 15 minutes by foot. This is not the George V, but it is very reasonably priced, well staffed and well located. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “It's good enough”
Reviews.Author: Marcia_Teles
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked Hotel Monge based on the reviews posted on TripAdvisor. They are all true: about the good and (few) bad things. Reservation was made easily, by e-mail; and answers were prompt and acurate. It is really a cosy, comfortable hotel; the staff is all friendly (praises to Madame Julie); breakfast is worth it; the location is great; the rooms are clean; overall, it's a good cost X benefit choice for Paris. We stayed in a room with a view to Arenes de Lutrece, bathtub and no shower curtain. The room, elevator and public areas were small (although we expected it), and we found it really challenging to take a bath without getting the bathroom all wet. Phone calls were charged at a high rate. Hotel Monge should be praised for what it is: a nice two-star hotel in Paris, well located and not expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful introduction”
Reviews.Author: Armcc
Reviews.Content: A wonderful introduction to Paris. I stayed with my nine year old daughter for a few nights in late February 2007. After reading so many bad reviews of other hotels in Paris, I was not sure what to expect from any reasonably priced hotel. We found Residence Monge clean, comfortable, easily accessible from the metro, and in a very nice part of town. (Place Monge station did seem to be closed at some point - so Cardinal Lemoine station may be the better option - near a great cafe too!!) As we visited other areas of Paris, I was happy to go "home" to Residence Monge. I would agree with the last few reviews, and add that there are also wonderful parks nearby, including Jardin des Plantes, which was a nice retreat from the tourist track. Julie at the front desk was very friendly, helpful and accommodating. I would also second the recommendation for La Papillotte, a nearby restaurant located off of Rue Mouffetard.

Reviews.Title: “a comfortable and cosy home from home”
Reviews.Author: simbasmum
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Monge with my 15 year old daughter for 4 nights in February and we had a wonderful experience. It is in such a good neighbourhood area, with 4 boulangeries within 2 minutes walk! 10 minutes walk to Notre Dame and the Seine. The hotel were so helpful, giving instructions how to get places, and even lending me an umbrella on our last wet morning! the lift is small, yes, but it was a highlight for my daughter - Paris is all about quirkiness!! Had some great meals in rue Mouffetard and around - the hotel recommended La Papillotte, which was wonderful - we also had cheese fondue, which was good, but too rich for my daughter unfortunately! The hotel is located between two metro stops - Place Monge and Cardinal Lemoine - on different lines, but the Place Monge station is due to be closed for a couple of months very soon for refurbishment, so check first whether it will be open. We had a room at the front of the hotel, with a little balcony, think it was on the 4th or 5th floor - it was very cosy, yes, it would have been nice to have tea-making facilities, but the hotel provided us with hot water and cups without a problem when we desperately needed an afternoon cup of tea! Showerhead wouldn't stay up so had to take it off to shower, which made hairwashing quite a challenge, but all part of the experience really. Would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a French experience, in a convenient location, oh yes, and it was all lovely and clean!

Reviews.Title: “Commendable hotel”
Reviews.Author: JonesLlanrug
Reviews.Content: Jones, Llanrug. Very well managed hotel. Very clean and very helpful staff. Rooms well presented with modern bathroom facilities. Good value breakfast and sensible prices for accomodation. Highly recommended 2* Hotel in nice area, close to main attrections and within 100m(ish) to two metro stations. A must in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our home base!”
Reviews.Author: Ruskies
Reviews.Content: Wendy & Greg - Winnipeg Canada ....................what a honeymoon! We spent 9 days in Paris and stayed at The Hotel Monge. It was fantastic; clean, friendly, great breakfasts, quaint and very inexpensive. Very central and within walking distance to all the attractions. Metro close if you want to ride. If ever in Paris again we will stay at this hotel. We have recommended it to two other couples who are travelling to Paris in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “A really lovely hotel in a lovely district close to all”
Reviews.Author: Caddy5Jersey
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monge was a lovely place to stay - really great value for a long weekend to celebrate our first wedding anniversary. Staff were very helpful, location amazing and metro so close - although Notre Dame and Latin Quarter was only 15 minutes walk. Mouffetard was a lovely district up very closeby, with great bars and restaurants - we loved 1001 Nights Morrocan bar with hooker pipes and Avocado milk shakes! The market at Mouffetard on Sunday was gorgeous - cheese meat fish coffee veg chocs baked goods.......etcetcetc Any way this was by far the best value stay in Paris, and saw some gorgeus quieter quarters as well as the main sights.

Reviews.Title: “hated the monge”
Reviews.Content: We were booked in for 9 nights late December 2006-on trip advisor rankings-17th out of 1600 odd.What a major disappointment-unattractive & uninviting small public areas, ancient rooms with worn out old sheets & towels, a lift that did not work after 8 p.m., bad luck if you stayed on high levels or had mobility problems. Owner Julie completely charmless (especially after reading trip advisor reviews as to how wonderful she was). In Paris you are never far from something interesting or attractive-this hotel is in the most boring & unattractive strip of the whole Latin Quarter. My 21 year old son (who charmed everyone he met on our 1 month long holiday in 4 cities) has respiratory problems and has to boil water for sinus rinsing requested kettle after explaining why & was told there was no kettle available. We booked out early were charged 1 extra night penalty (understandably). What annoyed me was that all of a sudden room rate increased-I did not bother arguing as I was happy to be out of there. We had stayed in London at k&k hotel which was terrific for 1 week before coming to Paris. On the plane from London my wife & I were seated in row 13 next to a man who had serious hygeine problems, the bag with ALL of our clothes was lost for 6 days (eventually returned by B.A.) & we stayed in this terrible hotel for 2 nights! Talk about bad luck! Fear not dear readers ,we found the wonderful Hotel Abbatial on Boulevarde Saint Germain , completed our stay incident free & moved on to Athens&Hong Kong & had a great holiday. Please do not stay in this hotel (Monge) as Paris is an enchanting city & you do not want your holiday ruined.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: RBCumbria
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Residence Monge en route from Barcelona to London on the Train. I arrived at 9.15am and was given access to a bedroom straight away. I was even able to take breakfast which was plentiful and well prepared. The owners were most helpful, spoke good English and dealt with a problem with the TV remote most efficiently. The room I had was not big but was adequate. Unlike the previous writer, I do not expect a kettle in a Paris Hotel!Residence Monge is ideally situated between two metro stops. I booked the hotel after reading reports on Trip Advisor and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Eltator
Reviews.Content: I think the best value of this hotel is its great sittuation. It is in the middle of the Latin neighbourhood, one of the nicest places of Paris, with a lot of brasseries and cafes and a lot of nice places to visit. The hotel has another great value: its kind and charming staff. From the check in time to the checkout time they were always very pleasant. The room was quite big (especially the bathroom!) and clean. The room had a big and handy wardrobe, TV, telephone and minibar. Oh! And it also had free WiFi access. Obviously, it is a budget hotel and does not have the comodities of a higher class hotel, but I highly reccomend it if you want a cheap and charming hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monge: OVER RATED? Me, my husband and sister all seem to think so.”
Reviews.Author: pugs633
Reviews.Content: We booked a double and triple (100/130 Euro) based on reviews on tripadvisor and were sorely disappointed. :( My husband & I backpacked SouthEast Asia for 3 months straight so we are not picky or demanding by any stretch of the imagination. Positives: windows are double paned and the rooms are clean. But we think there are better hotels out there. We found the Familia Hotel MUCH better last time we were in Paris (they were booked this time around ) 1. Staff did not seem to make an effort to be friendly at all. When we checked in we were simply given our keys and pointed to the elevator/stairs. We were suprised since others raved about the service. We barely got a smile out of them- I wondered for a minute if THEY were the ones paying us to stay there. 2. Elevator fits only 1 person with luggage or 2 small people. The dark winding staircase was not much better to lug your baggage up. 3. There is not clock or coffee/teamaker in the room. Considering they managed to have a minibar in each room, hmmmm. 4. Don't expect to sleep in at all as the housekeeper starts banging and vacuuming at around 8 am. Ok? it's supposed to be a holiday 5. Finally, we found the beds pretty rough to sleep on. I woke up with backaches (normally I never have back issues). The last couple nights I found it helpful to sleep on my stomach. Anyways, hope this helps! I will NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone that I care about. Bon voyage! Paris is amazing :)

Reviews.Title: “Impressive service! Nice boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bwie_sg
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just came back from a 4D/3N stay with Hotel Monge. We selected this little parisian hotel after reading the reviews on trip advisor. The hotel is a short 2-3mins walk from the underground station. If you are planning to do your sight-seeing and travel around paris on the underground, you'll find the proximity to the underground station a huge convenience. Hotel Monge on the other hand is not exactly close (this I mean within 300m radius) the main attractions like the lourve, champs elysse etc but it is quite near to notre dame. Fantastic facilities / amenities around the hotel too - pharmacy, restaurants, takeaways and supermarket. We got a small room facing the streets - it has a double bed complete with an ensuite bathroom with shower. Everything is 'city-sized' - small and compact. Extremely clean. No problems at all! Julie, Juliet and the rest of the staff at the hotel are unfailingly polite and helpful all the time. They provided us with hot water (for tea) every night we were there. Answered our queries and recommended us where to get late night supper, paris style. Breakfast is superb - croissant are nice! Most importantly - we accidentally left behind an item of sentimental value and emailed Julie about it. She promised she would search around for it and she did! She found our belonging and kept it safe while we picked it up on our way back from Milan. Were really grateful to them for it. Overall a great hotel. The service was simply all-rounded. Would definitely go back there again. Pity the lift could only fit one person + 1 piece of luggage.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet refuge”
Reviews.Author: katyc67
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Monge in July, and really liked it. It was like a refuge to us after having a bad hotel experience and being robbed in London. We didn't know what to expect and we were pleasantly surprised with a comfortable room, quiet surroundings, and a convenient location. Julie and all the front desk people were extremely kind to us. I had communicated about our incident in London to Julie via email (we thought about canceling the rest of our trip), and she was very sympathetic. She let me use the internet in the lobby for free several times...only after reading some more reviews here did I realize that she usually charges people. Our room was small but comfortable, with a foam type mattress. The bathroom was a decent size, and was the type with a bathtub and the handheld shower attachment. Having the AC was great, as it was hot while we were there and it worked fine. Our room had a little balcony that looked out on to the street, with the full size windows that opened up to it. The location is convenient, with easy walking to restaurants, Notre Dame area, and several metro stations. If you are looking for an affordable hotel in Paris, I recommend Hotel Monge.

Reviews.Title: “A nice home base”
Reviews.Author: moserbike
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. The location was great, the room was comfortable and quiet with a great view overlooking the old Roman arena and the staff was very helpful and attentive. I loved the easy access to the market at Place Monge and the Rue Mouffetard and appreciated having the Metro just steps away. I'm already thinking about my next trip to Paris, and this would be near the top of places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 57BelAir
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monge for one night in June 2006. We had a large triple room with a balcony and nice bathroom with a tub. Rue Monge is busy, but our room was quiet. The old Roman ampitheatre, the Arene Lutece, is behind the hotel, and there is a Metro entrance right around the corner. The air conditioning worked well and was quiet, which was a big plus, because it was warm when we were there. There are lots of restaurants on the nearby Rue Mouffetard. Our room was about 140 euros. So while the Monge did not make me say, "Wow!", it's a perfectly fine hotel, reasonably priced, and in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tchrlorrie
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent 3 nights in this well-located, impeccably clean, friendly hotel. Hotel Monge was exactly what we were looking for and we will gladly return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Monge is the perfect/inexpensive place to stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: momflys
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 5 day/4 night stay at the Hotel Monge with my 21 year old daughter and loved it! It was in a wonderful location;close walk to many places, between two metro stops and was only a 42 euro cab ride from CDG. Our room was a corner room over looking the Rue Monge(somewhat noisy at night with windows open) but fun to look out . The room was quite large and very clean-appeared to be recently updated. The bathroom was spotless and larger than others have complained about on this forum. The beds were quite comfortable and had enough blankets for my daughter who is ALWAYS cold. It had a armoire closet,minibar fridge and cable TV.(The only thing that I can fault this hotel about was the towels-coarse and needed to be replaced.)The staff were delightful too. We did take the breakfast downstairs twice for 6.50 euros apiece to save us time a couple mornings and it was quite sufficient. It included a big pot of coffee (about 3 cups!!)and hot milk for each of us,various cheeses,jams and butter with a bread basket along with a yoghurt. After spending 3.50 for one coffee down the street, my daughter and I decided that for our "coffee needs"-this was easier and more convenient. I fly to Paris often for my job and think that this hotel is much more convenient to great restaurants and shops than the two 4 star hotels that my company puts me in for my crew layovers.We paid 98 euros for two a night and it was really a great place to enjoy Paris. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: giggling_gecko
Reviews.Content: We just returned from this brilliant hotel. Any negative reviews written on this website do reflect the fact that this is a budget hotel - yes the lift is small and the rooms are not huge. But for the price we paid these things are barely worth mentioning! Our room was spotlessly clean, very fresh, the hotel very welcoming, staff great, the shower very powerful and rejuvenating, the bed very comfortable and the location was perfect! The room was very bright and the bathroom was white - always a bonus. Delightful narrow stairs running down spirally around the lift; yes the lift will make you smile it is so small but who cares if you've got too much luggage and you need to make two trips in it - it's fun! This was a '2nd honeymoon' for us following an extravagant trip earlier in the year to Mexico staying in a most gorgeous 5* hotel. We can honestly say The Hotel Monge lived up to all our expectations and we had absolutely no complaints. You will not be disappointed! This must be the best hotel for the price and location in the whole of Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnandLisa
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location, easy to get to from the airport, with the metro nearby and within walking distance of a lot of the major attractions. As stated in many of the other reviews, Julie was really helpful, always happy to help. We chose to have breakfast outside the hotel - just wanted to sample the local patisseries. There is a laundromat nearby (a bit busy on a Sunday evening however), and a supermarket too. Another great find was a street off Rue Mouffetard, called rue du Pot de fer, had a great selection of restaurants, we ate at 3 different ones, great service & food & reasonably priced. We didn't find the rooms too small, we were on the second floor and noise was not an issue with the doors closed. The bathroom wasn't as small as I expected, so all good. Would definitely go back (had stayed there 12 years ago & is still good)

Reviews.Title: “Good, safe hotel and pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: violet125
Reviews.Content: My husband picked this hotel based on tripadvisors' reviews. We stayed for 3 nights. We were not dissappointed. This was a very nice hotel. The location is very good. There is a lively street with lots of restaurants not too far away called Mouffetard. If you ask for a place to go eat the hotel will send you to a restaurant on that street, Jardin Ivy, which we were not too crazy about, you get a coupon for a free drink. There are lots of bakeries near the hotel. Yummy! :) The hotel is easily accessible using the metro. There were lots of stairs to the metro exit near the hotel. We later found out that using the exit further from the hotel (1 or 2 block) that it was easier because there is an escalator to that one. There also happens to be a very interesting market Sunday mornings by that metro worth visiting. The elevator was very small, we thought that was funny, the luggage only fit with one person in it. The shower head is hand held and it was a challenge not to spray everywhere, there was no shower curtains. We would stay there again and would highly recommend this place. Julie and staff were very nice. You can leave your luggage there when you check out but they leave it in the lobby, we had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “No problems at the Monge”
Reviews.Author: badabingdad
Reviews.Content: A great find thanks to this website. A clean and comfortable hotel. Great location for eating out and exploring. Would not hesitate to go back. Liked the room facing the garden - nice and quiet. Helpful and friendly staff. Couldnt' really ask for much more for around 100 euros per night. Need a place to eat - just ask Julie!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: thermomanlar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on the first few nights of our honeymoon, Our room was on the 3rd floor overlooking the street - Although the traffic was quite noisy you couldn't hear it when the windows were closed. Julie is fantastic, a huge source of advise. The area around the hotel is fantastic and with a bit of looking you will find brilliant restaurants and pastry shops. We will definitely be staying here again when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Krubs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monge the first couple of night's of our honeymoon. It is a great place to stay for those on a budget. Good location. Excellent front desk staff - very approachable, feel free to ask questions. Very clean and comfortable. Truly enjoyed it and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, not special.”
Reviews.Author: spiderbait
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews on this site, we booked 2 nights here in September by email. The response to our emails by Julie was quick and in English, which was extremely helpful. The room was very clean and pleasant, but we were a little surprised by how tiny the bathroom was - large guests would find the shower a challenge! On the plus side there was plenty of hot water. It's a great location, very close to 2 metro stations and easy to get to from the airport. But beware of the endless stairs on the metro if you have heavy luggage! Julie and her staff were very helpful. The breakfast is pretty basic, I would go out, plenty of good places nearby and easy to walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Strongly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Britchip
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 nights. Even though the washroom is very small, the hotel is cute and there are corridors...great value for money. there's a train station nearby and the laudrette is just 2 mins walk I chose this hotel because of the review posted in tripadvisor and I was not disapponted at all.

Reviews.Title: “More Than Met Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoMembers
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit to Paris. My wife and I and our friends stayed at the Hotel Residence Monge for 6 nights in early September. We chose this hotel primarily because of the Trip Advisor overall rating and the reviews here. Our room was #401, a corner room with twim beds pushed together. The room had a small seating area in addition to the bed area, and looked over the small amphitheater behind the hotel. The room was comfortable and quiet. The bathroom was small but not tiny, and contained a tub with no shower curtain and a hend held shower (not atypical in Paris hotels). We dealt with this easily: I was very careful to always keep the spray pointed toward the backwall, and my wife chose to shower sitting down in the tub. We had a few chuckles about this, but it was fine. We enjoyed the fact that the Hotel Monge's rooms are airconditioned, as Paris was warm during our stay. We did not use any of the products in the in-room mini fridge, but we used it to chill the wines we bought to the room. The linens and towels were clean of good quality. The room was cleaned well every day. The elevator is small - 3 passengers max and only one person with luggage at a time. So, we normally took it going up, and took the stairs going down. The location of the hotel is great. It is in a middle class working neighborhood, with many small shops, bucheries, charcuteries, boulangeries, and tabacs. The Rue Monge Metro station is within 200 feet of the hotel's front door, and there is another station 2 blocks from Hotel Monge. We walked Rue Monge and other main avenues in the neighborhood as late as 10PM and felt safe. There are many good resturants within 15 minutes walk, and Ille de Cite - Notre Dame - is less than a 20 minute walk. One of the main assets of this hotel is Julie, the owner and operator of the hotel. Julie was a joy to work, with from working out the reservations to the day we checked out. Julie is at the front desk perhaps 10 hours per day, and was there every day but one of our stay. She made two sets of dinner reservations for us, ordered taxis for us twice, made two restaurant recommendations (1 on Ille St Louis and 1 in the Rue Moufetard area) that were excellent, and generally acted as our chief source of advice. She has a delightful personality. Her husband handles the morning in-house breakfast and other chores, and he along with the other staff, most of whom have been with Julie for many years, were absolutley great. Hotel Residence Monge is not the Four Seasons by any means, but it gave us 3 Star quality at a great price. An excellent value!

Reviews.Title: “Small in Size - Big in Value”
Reviews.Author: Frites
Reviews.Content: My wife and i just came back from a trip to England, Scotland and Paris. We used Trip Advisor to find all of the places to stay after a friend recommended it and that is how we came across Hotel Monge. This Hotel was not the biggest in the world and the rooms were a little small, but who spends time in their room anyway in the middle of Paris. The hotel is located right in the heart of the Latin Quarter and literally one block from Notre Dame. The people that work at the Hotel all know english and were very helpful, not to mention that the crussonts we had for breakfast there were some of the best I have ever had in my life. The hotel was very clean and each room also has a bathroom with a small shower which is always a plus. Directly down the street from the hotel is probably the best pastry shop in all of Paris called Erik Kaiser. Along with that within waling distance is a great little street with all of the crepperies and little cafes Paris is best known for. As far as getting around the city goes the Hotel is situated right on top of the Place Monge rail station which makes it easy to get anywhere you want and is within walking distance to Notre Dame, the Pantheon, and even the Luve and Eifel Tower if you have your walking shoes wth you. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who would be going to Paris. You get the entire Paris experience for less money and staying here as opposed to the big old resort hotels really gives you the feeling that you are a resident of Paris and not just another tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Good but..”
Reviews.Author: Zh.Ou.
Reviews.Content: I have some mixed feeling about this hotel. My expectation might have been a little bit high because of the good comments about this hotel.
