It seems the hotel has just downgraded from 3 star to 2 Star. We paid 97EUR per night. The room is definitely much cleaner than a normal 2 star hotel and very quiet, but also very small and basic. The TV channels include BBC and MSNBC. The internet was out of order for the first several days, which might have been a blessing if you are in Paris. The location is excellent, close to Latin Quater ( Patheon, Luxembourg Garden and many other churches). The owner was very helpful. We did not take the breakfast, which is 6.50 EUR and probably worth of the money since the pastry is cheaper outside but with coffee you would endup with this amount or more. There are four pastry shops and 2 Chinese resterants (take-out type) within 2 blocks. One can take sub lines 7 or 10 to get the hotel. Do I want to come back? I might try to find some thing fancier but this hotel is definitely an excellent fall-back option.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Houston, TX (live here, not from here!)
Reviews.Title: “Great Base for Mother/Daughter Trip”
Reviews.Author: MountHolyokeMom
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monge was a great place to spend our first two nights in France. It was a perfect combination of price, comfort, safety, cleanliness and friendliness. Both my mother (age 63) and I agree we would stay here again with pleasure. We booked our room about one month in advance via email, and the hotel was sold our during our stay (late May). My mother and I requested a room with two beds, and were assigned a room on the fourth floor, overlooking the ampitheatre. The twin beds are apparently pushed together at times to form a larger bed, but worked as separate beds just as well. We didn't mind the spiraling staircase at all; it's absolutely typical of Paris. We enjoyed open windows the first night, but turned on the A/C the second night--and it worked beautifully. Madame was pleasant, but bless her heart she is overworked! She was happy to oblige (and correct!) my French, and was equally warm with my mother in English. The breakfast downstairs seemed a wee bit expensive, and so we sought our breakfasts elsewhere. Early rising was a bit of a nuisance, since the night concierge sleeps behind the desk on a cot (and you don't want to disturb him), and the front doors are shuttered. Non-hotel details: While a cab from the airport to the Hotel Monge might cost you $100, the RER/Metro option only cost us about $15 each--and it was a fun adventure--particularly for my mother. We only had one rolling mid-sized suitcase each, and that helped. We are generally fit, and had no problem walking from the hotel to the Notre Dame and beyond. (We actually walked to the Arc de Triomphe, which is a great way to work off jet lag.) Be sure to splurge on a beer in the Jardin du Luxembourg, and let your eyes feast on everything around you!

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElBleato
Reviews.Content: Struck lucky twice now with the help of TripAdvisor (see Hotel Domus Praetoria in Rome). I stayed at the Residence Monge with my wife and two teenage daughters for 3 nights last weekend. We were given rooms next door to each other. Both rooms were comfortable and spotlessly clean. The service levels at the hotel are high. We all highly rated breakfast. Overall superb value for money. The hotel is in a pleasant area with easy Metro connections. A couple of streets over is a 'buzzing' area with lots of bars and restaurants. The hotel recommended a restaurant 'Jardin d'Ivy' which was superb. I am fortunate to have eaten at many famous name restaurants around the world (including Paris) on business. I cannot recall a restaurant I have enjoyed more - the quality of the food and the lovely ambience was just great. With both the hotel and the restaurant it was clear that the owners, who were actively on-site, really cared.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the recommendations!”
Reviews.Author: Noodle10
Reviews.Content: Thank you so much! I wouldn't have found Hotel Residence Monge without this website. We stayed for 5 nights in August 2006 and found it to be just as good as all the reviewers before me had said. All the staff couldn't have been more helpful. The room was a good size and absolutely spotless. We went for a room overlooking the park-like Arenes du Lutece which was slightly more expensive than the road facing rooms but worth it as we could have the windows open and listen to birdsong instead of traffic (although all the rooms are double-glazed and airconditioned so if you were in a street-facing room, you probably wouldn't be disturbed.) Julie's continental breakfasts are very good value - 6.50 Euro for a huge pot of coffee, a croissant, lots of bread and selection of jams and cheeses and a yoghurt. We were disappointed the two times that we ate outside the hotel for breakfast so would recommend the hotel breakfast. I have two tips - ask Julie's advice for good restaurants. We had the best meal of our visit at a small restaurant (Jardin D'Ivy) on Rue Mouffetard recommended by Julie - she even gave us a voucher for a free aperitif there. Secondly if you come on Eurostar, the route recommended to me by Julie on the way back, (we found our own way to the hotel but had to negotiate loads of stairs with our suitcases, and trek for miles on Metro interchanges!) is Line 4 from Gard du Nord, changing to Line 10 at Odeon. You get off at Cardinal Lemoine and it is a 5 minute walk to the hotel. (Place Monge Metro station is closer to the hotel but there are many more stairs to navigate!) My only complaint is like another reviewer, the towels, although very clean, are a bit threadbare and could do with being replaced.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel but need new towels”
Reviews.Author: Andre_Stabel
Reviews.Content: The location is good. Near metro station and Rue Moufetard where you can shop for fresh fruits, water, etc. at a small grocery store and have very good restaurants. The room is very clean. Tiny elevator. The only item that should be renewed: the towels are old and even a fabric softner would not work. Wifi access (paid) in the room was very confortable. Sometimes difficult to connect but when connected we could talk with our kids at home with Skipe with no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, lovely view”
Reviews.Author: Malati
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed in a double room on the fourth or fifth floor (can't remember which) facing the back, and the view from our room - a green park with an amphi-theater in it - was wonderful! The room standard was excellent, with the lack of shower curtain being the only negative thing I can think of. When we asked for an extra blanket and sheet - since we don't like sharing that - we immediately got that delivered to our room. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel, but instead went to the lovely Keyser's bakery (further down on the same street), who surely must have the best pain aux noix in Paris. The Saturday market on Place Monge was also a nearby treasure trove for delicious food. The location of the hotel is extremely convenient for Quartier Latin and - if you don't mind walking - the rest of Paris. Something that might be worth mentioning - although it wasn't a problem for us - is that the stairs and the elevator are very narrow. We will definitely stay in Hotel Residence Monge again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for a Paris stay”
Reviews.Author: B2Travelers
Reviews.Content: In april we stayed for five nights. The 5th Arr. location is outstanding, easy walk to Notre Dame, Pantheon, Sorbonne areas. A block from Rue Mofftard with varied dining options. Metro at the corner. Rooms had everything we needed and were clean and comfortable. Not large but more than I had expected for the price. Julie was terrific in making suggestions and helping with general information. Would gladly stay again any time...hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and Great”
Reviews.Author: JSO
Reviews.Content: I agree with almost everything everyone else has said. I stayed there 2 nights in July 2006 in a second floor double overlooking the street. Absolutely no street noise when the windows were closed. Great AC, nice bathroom, small shower (but great water pressure and temp). Bed was nice and actually a double (not 2 twins put together). Room was standard Paris size, TV had ~10 channels including CNBC europe and BBC world. Julie was great, internet in the lobby for 1 euro, great for checking email and stuff. Didnt try the breakfast, but there are so many bakeries and stuff around. The Rue Moutefard (sp?) has great restaurants and is a great stroll at night for dessert. Monge metro stop is two steps away, Cardinal Lemoine is at the end of the block. Great place to stay if you are looking for a simple, clean, good valued place thats in a great left bank neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “A really good choice!”
Reviews.Author: panconuva
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent for our purposes - clean, centrally located in a nice neighbourhood, and staffed by friendly and helpful people. Our room faced the back of the building (overlooking the Arènes de Lutece) and was well-equipped with spotless bathroom, fridge and double bed. The hotel is within five minutes' walk of a great selection of bakeries and cafés, as well as three metro stations. The sunday market at Place Monge is well worth a visit, and nearby rue Mouffetard and Place de la Contrescarpe have everything you could ask for in terms of restaurants, markets and lovely little bars. Cinephiles will be pleased to find so many cinemas (independent and chain) within walking distance in the Latin Quarter. If you want a plush hotel with a concierge and room service then obviously this place isn't for you, but if you're in Paris to experience the city this is a great budget option!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Servicable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: B0utiqueTraveller
Reviews.Content: I made a mistake and book this hotel for the wrong month. Since the hotel was full when we arrived Julie, our host, took it upon herself to find us another hotel that was avaible for the length of our stay. It eventuated that we could stay at the Residence Monge for two of the nights we were in Paris, and we were very pleased with what we got. While there is nothing in the hotel to blow you away, it is clean and tidy, the staff were friendly and helpful, and it was reasonably priced. It is also easy to get to via the metro, and was just far enough away from the busy tourist areas that you could retreat to the hotel if you wanted to. If I was going to Paris again I would probably stay closer to the action, but it was perfect for our first time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monge vs. Hotel Des Grandes Ecoles”
Reviews.Author: CTTravelBug
Reviews.Content: On recommendation of a friend, we booked three nights at Hotel Monge. As mentioned in previous posts, Julie and family are most helpful. She made two dinner reservations for us, (one via email before we left) and one while we were there. Every morning I aked her in French (she does speak English) which was the best route to get somewhere. She was helpful in guiding us to the Sun morning fresh market in the park at the Monge Metro stop. I had known about it but didn't know just when it was held. Shower tiny but bathroom big enough. Windows opening on street are thermal, sound-resistant type and we had no trouble sleeping. Just a few blocks away, we spent our last night at Hotel Des Grandes Ecoles (HDGE) (mentioned in the Paris DK Guidebook--therefore very popular). In comparison, we were so glad to have the majority of time in the Hotel Monge: air conditioned, a small refrigerator, TV and Julie vs. HDGE: no AC, no refrig, no TV and front desk person ALWAYS busy with other guests. HDGE does have the great courtyard to relax in and bigger showers. I don't think HDGE had internet access but Hotel Monge has it in the lobby closet. There is a fee. Both hotels are clean with tiny elevators, breakfast served in dining area: 6.50 E extra pp. Much more fun to go to local cafe for cafe au lait after buying pastry at the many patisseries in the area. Both within walking distance of the Seine and a few blocks in the other direction to the Pantheon, Sorbonne, and Rue Mouffetard.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute delight!”
Reviews.Author: globalnomad79
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the adjacent Hotel des Arenes earlier this year (not bad), I have to say Hotel Monge was definitely a much better deal. The room we had was small (but hey, this is Paris) but more importantly, it was well equipped (working TV, desk, wardrobe and very decent bathroom) and VERY CLEAN. The beds were not too bad either. Our first-floor room overlooked the courtyard - probably not the best view but it was fine. I'm starting to really like this area of Paris with its close proximity to almost everything and a couple of metro stops nearby. There's a nice bakery just down the street as well where I had some lovely chouquettes (sugar-studded melt-in-your-mouth soft pastries that are simply to-die-for!). Again, if you're after decent accomodation that won't blow your budget (we had our twin room for 95 Euros), you can't go wrong here!

Reviews.Title: “good stay true to reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five days and it was just as the positive reviews had indicated. The hotel isin a good part of Paris. Rue Monge leads straight to central Paris. There are some beautiful bakeries close by and Julie, the concierge, was always helpful. Of course Paris traffic goes all night but that didn't matter after a while. It was a good honest place to stay. We felt pleased that we had chosen this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pinkyvw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Monge for 3 nights and were very happy with the accommodations. The rooms were clean and the hotel is close to Rue Mouffetard--(incidentally the Cave de la Bourgogne cafe at 144 Rue Mouffetard was great!). There are friendly cafes nearby and the metro is fairly close. The hotel staff were incredibly helpful. I would absolutely consider this hotel for future stays in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel! No complaints!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a five day stay at the Hotel Monge. I decided to stay here based on the reviews I read on this site. I am very happy to have found this hotel. First, it's a great value. Second, it's incredibly clean, and for Paris, the rooms are a decent size. Third, the location is great. Finally, the service is exceptional - even by American standards. Julie is the most helpful, friendly person imaginable. I will definitely stay at the Hotel Monge in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with Hotel Monge”
Reviews.Author: ktown_1397
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monge for 4 nights in May 2006, and found that the Hotel was exactly as expected from having read the reviews on this website; we were very happy with our choice. We were in room 54, which faced the street and had a wonderful little balcony. There was street noise when the balcony doors were open but we loved the view up the street and being able to relax on the balcony with a bottle of wine, and with the balcony doors closed noise was not a problem. We would definitely return to this hotel, we thought it was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Lovely Hotel in a Beautiful City”
Reviews.Author: nijedu
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I returned yesterday from a wonderful six days in Paris where we stayed at the Hotel Residence Monge. From the first minute of arrival until the time we stepped into the taxi to leave, we could not have been more pleased with this lovely hotel and it's wonderful staff. Julie is an excellent hostess, who suggested delightful restaurants, and answered questions, with a smile. (You should ask for her recommendations) Our Garden view room was immaculate, and the sight of the Roman ampitheater from the window a bonus! We requested a double, with bath, one large bed, and a garden view. Although the room was small, it was a pleasant surprise to find it bigger than expected! The bathroom ~ likewise, bigger than I expected, based on previous descriptions posted on this website. A bonus was the airconditioning, which came in handy with the unexpected heat at the end of last week! We found the small elevator exactly as described, small, but efficient. You should purchase the Metro pass as soon as you can. We purchased a five day pass, which provided us with access to both types of metro (local and RER), as well as the bus system. There is a very close entrance to the metro by the ampitheater ~ left from the front of the hotel and left at the next corner. Our favorite area was Rue Mouffetard, which is a three to five minute walk from the hotel. We spent our last morning walking thru the markets and eating breakfast in one of the outdoor cafes. We spent two wonderful evenings at the Restaurant Le Jardin D'Ivy. Ivy and her husband own this restaurant, and she is the artist responsible for all of the art decorating the walls. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel, but most tables were full every morning. We preferred to eat breakfast at different spots every day. My husband likes a cup of tea (or two) everynight at bedtime and the staff cheefully provided hot water for him to take to our room. I took a few minutes then to check e-mail. The computer is located in a tiny closet in the reception area; wreless service is not available at this time. This hotel is a jewel, and I definitely recommend it. We would stay here again ~ definitely!

Reviews.Title: “A place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JJBT
Reviews.Content: Good location, impeccable room, nice staff. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a wonderful area!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for 5days/4nights. It is in a wonderful location in the Latin Quarter and near all the main sites. The metro is a block away or it is a short walk to most sites. Julie and the staff were all very helpful and friendly. We had a triple room and although it was a little tight for space it was adequate. The bathroom was a decent size and it had a tub. It was very clean. We had the breakfast and enjoyed it. It mainly consists of fresh bread, yogurt, and coffee. If you choose to eat outside the hotel there are many choices just around the corner. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and I would definetly stay here again. On a different note for Americans. I found everyone in the area to be very friendly and it was easy to get around town on the Metro. I do not speak French. Getting off at the Eurostar train station can be rather hectic and the area around the train station is not very nice at all.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel after reading the wonderful reviews on this website and after also viewing the pictures posted. We were certainly not disappointed with our choice. Julie was extremely helpful with booking and also responded promptly to emails. She was also friendly and helpful in person. The hotel is conveniently located by the Cardinal Lemoine Metro station although it is also close to the Place Monge station. Would definitely recommend if you are going to do a lot of sightseeing that you buy a Metro Pass as that kept us from waiting in line to purchase tickets every day. Lots of bakeries and patisseries in the area. Would definitely recommend walking down to St. Germain (only a 5 minute walk) and buying a baguette sandwich from one of the vendors. They're excellent and reasonably priced. There is a computer in the lobby that guests are able to use although beware that it is a French keyboard so the keys are all jumbled up. And it is also unable to connect to AOL. The room was great! Large bed. Lots of storage. Television (with CNBC and MTV Germany to name a few channels). Nice clean bathroom with clean towels everyday, although the shower was MINI. You couldn't hear the noise from the street too badly with the windows closed (we were on the first floor facing the street). We didn't eat the breakfast based on the not-so-great reviews here, so we can't comment on that. Although we did find going to the bakery a fun part of our day because we got to try something new and sweet every morning (and cheaply too!). All and all would definitely recommend this hotel to prospective travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Merci”
Reviews.Author: elawler147
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monge was a great hotel.Thanks again Julie for your kindness.The rooms were fantastic.This hotel and location has to be one of the best for all around Paris location.The rooms were large and very clean.Just a block from several metro stations.Staff was very kind.You made our trip to Paris very pleasent.Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay At Hotel Monge”
Reviews.Author: OnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: The first impression I got when I walked in was ‘This place is clean’ – looked clean and smelled clean. Throughout the week I would always see someone cleaning something. My room was number 66, top floor single in the back. Again, clean; the walls had a nice peach wall paper; it was plenty big enough for one person and having two people in it would not be unreasonable. A large armoire with plenty of space; 2 smaller beds pushed together to make a queen; a desk; a small TV; and a stocked mini fridge. The bathroom was small but actually had a counter at the sink where you could put your ‘stuff’. The bed was comfortable and it had two large US type pillows. The room had a view of the Arena which was especially nice. I would come back to the hotel in the afternoons for a nap and it was great to hear the sounds of children playing. On Sunday morning there was a spirited game of football between two different fire companies. The rest of the week there would be children playing, men playing boules, people picnicking. At night it was very, very quiet. I read before I left about the size of the elevator and the shower but they really are something best experienced. The elevator has an occupancy of 3 but you would need to be 3 VERY close friends. It worked all week though and being on the 6th floor that is what counted. The shower is about the size of the elevator with a handheld shower head. It takes a few days to master the art of getting clean without flooding the bathroom but it can be done. As someone said in a review, don’t drop the soap. The location was very good. There are all sorts of shops in the blocks around the hotel. A lot of boulangeries/patisseries, a great fromargerie across the street, cafes, and public transport in abundance. It is a 5-10 minute bus ride to Notre Dame, about 15 minutes on the metro to the Louvre. I paid 78 euros a night and felt I got a great bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Monge!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed for 3 nights at Monge and we liked the hotel! Booked a double room facing the street,with bath. Booked the room via email with Julie at the Hotel. She was always very nice, in email communication and at the hotel. Nice, clean room with a double bed and the bathroom was clean, large and newly decorated, great bathtub. We took a taxi from CDG to the Monge, about 43 Euros. And on our departure, the hotel helped us with booking a taxi. We had our breakfast outside the hotel. Very nice neighbourhood, close to Blvd Saint Germain, where you can find lots of cafe's and Brasseries. Cool Roman theatre behind the hotel as well. I can recommend this hotel if you want a clean hotel in a cosy area of Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel - Location, Price, Comfort”
Reviews.Author: CJFunny
Reviews.Content: Rooms: I stayed in two single rooms, both on the 6th floor. Both rooms were clean and comfortable, but the second room was a corner unit and had the space of a standard US hotel room. While I enjoyed my stay in both rooms, the extra space was a great help with my large suitcase. Both rooms faced the street and had terrific views of the street below and the outlaying city. While the street noise can be loud, you can close the windows and the noise isn't a problem. The bathrooms are a bit of a squeeze, so a larger person may not feel comfortable while in the shower. Metro: Metro Cardinal Lemoine is the closest Metro, but also in reasonable walking distance are the Place Monge and Jussieu metro stations. I used all of them frequently. Miscellaneous Info: A laundry and supermarket are only a block away. The hotel has air-conditioning (a MUST in the summer). If you arrive early or your room isn't ready, you can leave your luggage, go look around, and come back. OR you can sit in the lobby (it's comfortable with two chairs and a sofa). For the Late Crowd: The doors are locked at the hotel by 1:00am, but if you ring the night bell, someone will come let you in. Also, you can have guests in your room. I really loved this hotel. This was my second time in Paris, and my first time at the Hotel Residence Monge. The desk staff is truly wonderful - polite and helpful. When they were sold out for two nights of my stay, they gave me their honest opinions of other hotels in the area. I would recommend this hotel for singles and couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Buck02131
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monge based on the reviews here. The service and the rooms were great as advertised. Other extras not mentioned so far were things like keeping our bags for a day a week before we stayed there (we were taking the night train to Briancon) so we could visit a museum, having a computer with an Internet connection in a closet off the lobby which was free for the guests of the hotel, having stamps for postcards back the the United States. We had borrowed a cell phone and Julie's husband entered our recharge code into the phone for us because we had difficulty understanding the very fast French instructions. It seemed every time we asked where to go for some service it was available at the hotel. We didn't have breakfast there because we like to get out among the citizens but it looked very nice. The price was 81 Euros for room 24 which is one of the small ones looking out on the Street. It was quieter than our bedroom at home. Places not to miss nearby are the Place Monge market and the Rue Mouffetard markets.

Reviews.Title: “clean & decent 2-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: christy74
Reviews.Content: We got a triple room on the 2nd floor with pretty flowers over our balcony. We stayed here for four nights. The room was a good size for three people and quiet too when the french doors are closed considering that we were facing the main road. Housekeeping was performed daily and everything was clean. Downside were the towels, they were thin and once were given frayed ones. Julie and her staff were very helpful with regards to touristy questions and directions. This hotel is walking distance to rue mouffetard market which was marvelous with the array of food stalls, restaurants and cafes. And there is also monge fresh market every Wed. My husband said that Paris is such a food paradise and the people we met were friendly. There are 3 supermarkets nearby and laundry, just 3 minutes walk from the hotel. Bakeries are plentiful esp Kayser - try their creme brulee - Yummy! We really had a wonderful time in Paris and will be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: jeanr
Reviews.Content: Due to a mix up with bookings, we arrived in Paris with no accommodation booked. We had stayed at Hotel Monge a couple of years ago, and really enjoyed our stay, so decided to see if there was a room available this time. We had a street facing double room on the 5th floor. Everything was just as we remembered, spotlessly clean, and so close to bakeries and the metro. An easy walk to Notre Dame etc. This hotel is really value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Homey and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Residence Monge for 5 days on Nov. 10, and I must say, it was what I expected. The room was small but spotless. The bathroom was even smaller, BUT SPOTLESS. I must say, I've never seen a shower that small in my whole life, my wife joked that if you dropped the soap, you can't bend down but you have to pick it up with your feet! haha! It was an experience. Overall though, I was happy with the accomodations and for the price. All the staff were nice, polite and accomodating. Julie, (the owner I think), is really nice and very helpful, she answered all my little touristy concerns with pleasure. Happy to recommend it to all. As for me, at least now I know of a solid, affordable, and reliable place in Paris if I ever do end of in that part of the world again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monge lived up to Trip Advisor reviews”
Reviews.Author: catdad
Reviews.Content: Six of us just returned from Paris after a 4 nite stay at Hotel Residence Monge. Trip Advisor came through again! The hotel was exactly what we were looking for, and Julie was very helpful and accomodating to our every need. The rooms were immaculately clean, and though a little on the small side, we expected this and it had no bearing on our hotel stay experience. We did have an unfortunate experience upon our arrival in Paris: on our way to the hotel on the Paris Metro, my sister's passport was stolen. We hadn't even been in the city for a half hour when this nightmare occurred. When we got to the hotel, Julie provided us with the telephone number of the US Embassy and told us where we could find the closest police station to file a report. As we arrived on a holiday (Nov 11) the embassy was closed so we had to wait until Monday to get a new one issued. Fortunately, my sister had brought a xerox copy of her passport with her, so I'm sure this helped getting a new passport issued more quickly than normal. Lesson learned...do not travel in a big city without a neck pouch and keep all of your credit cards, drivers license, cash and passport in that pouch! And always, bring a copy of your passport. Regarding the hotel, we couldn't have asked for a cleaner place to stay. We also enjoyed the ambiance of the breakfast room off of the lobby, so we ate there every morning before starting off our day of touring Paris. There is a small room off the lobby that has free internet access, but beware that it does not support AOL, only MSN as far as we could tell. That was the only inconvenience we ran into at the hotel. Also... because we had to stay an extra day in Paris to secure a new passport, 3 of us (out of our party of 6) had to get another room for the night, and Julie was able to get us a triple room (with balcony) for about 50 Euros per person. The room was a little cramped with the extra bed, but we didn't mind, and the bathroom was a little bigger than the double we stayed in the previous 3 nights there. Bottom line...you can't beat the location and the price. It was truly a "boutique" hotel and exactly what we wanted. We will definitely stay there again, and despite the bad luck with the stolen passport, it will not affect our decision to come back to Paris again someday. Theft can occur anywhere--you just need to be diligent in protecting your valuables whenever you are in a crowd of people, such as in the Paris Metro. And speaking of the Metro, make sure you get a "Paris Visite" card. You can travel all over Paris on the Metro and busses with one ticket...no fumbling or standing in lines at Metro stations to get a one-way ticket each time you board.

Reviews.Title: “Just like being home!”
Reviews.Author: chaleymom
Reviews.Content: Since I had never been to a foreign country before, I didn't know what to expect from our hotel. I knew it came highly recommended by reading other reviews. I was pleasantly surprised and I wanted everyone else to know what a cozy, comforting atmosphere it was and especially how completely precious Julie is. She was extremely accommodating, knowledgeable, courteous and personable. I truly felt right at home in the "un-hotel-like" setting. The rooms were small, but comfortable - (the beautiful flowered sheets were a nice touch!). The entire hotel was spotless and the continental breakfast was second to none. I definitely know where I'll stay next time I'm in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience at the Hotel Residence Monge”
Reviews.Author: carmonle
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our first trip to Paris and stayed at Hotel Residence Monge on the strength of the recommendations that we read on this forum. We had a room on the 4th floor facing the Arenes de Lutece (not the street) and it was very quiet and comfortable. Our stay was for 9 nights. Not being familiar with Paris at all, I was pleasantly surprised at how centrally located the hotel is. It is between 2 metro lines (7 and 10), a 10 minute walk from Boulevard St. Michel and Notre Dame, also close to the Pantheon. We walked back to the hotel many times rather than taking a bus (the 47 bus runs down Rue Monge) or the metro. The room was adequately sized for a 2-star hotel. Very clean and neat. We had no trouble getting extra towels when we requested them. Julie's English is very good and she was always very polite and willing to answer any questions. I would certainly recommend this hotel to people and would consider staying there again. Eran

Reviews.Title: “Le Quartier Latin en Automne”
Reviews.Author: ellonway
Reviews.Content: As promised in my previous review in February 2005, I returned to Paris and again stayed at the Residence Monge. We stayed for 6 nights and this time we were in Room 15 on the 1st. floor, similar to the room we stayed in on our last visit, again looking onto rue Monge, with the exception that it did not have a balcony. The weather was warm and autumnal - some showers but also lots of sunshine - so different to that we experienced in February. By contrast, our experience of the hotel was reassuringly similar to our previous stay - the same warm, friendly and efficient staff, the tidy, clean, traditionally appointed room with a small but serviceable ensuite shower. A crack on the toilet seat was the only blemish to the hotel's reputation for pristine cleanliness. We did not breakfast at the hotel, choosing instead to have a morning café creme at one of the many cafés on the nearby Boulevard St-Germain. As usual a few restaurant recommendations - Le Languedoc, Boulevard de Port-Royal - traditional, family run, serving excellent food at reasonable prices and open on Sundays - try the cassoulet or the steak au poivre. We also lunched on galettes and crêpes at La Crêperie des Canettes, rue des Canettes in the 6th and at Page 35, rue du Parc-Royal in the 3rd. - both excellent value and frequented by the local regulars.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !!”
Reviews.Author: nimrod1911
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from 12 days in France. For the last 4 nites we stayed at the Hotel Monge. It was great. Staff very helpful with tour info, airport pickup, restaurants and local transportation (Metro, RER). Rooms are like new with full private bath. Comfortable beds, private TV, phone & computer hookup and A/C. Elevator served building. We were on the 4th. floor with a great view of the street. We would definitely return here again during another trip to France.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, with basic accomodations”
Reviews.Author: mlred99
Reviews.Content: After scouring trip advisor for reviews and also getting advice from a Paris native (who spoke very highly of the 5th district/Latin Quarter), my boyfriend and I booked a room at Hotel Monge for our 5 night stay in Paris. First impression was that the hotel is small, simple and clean. It was air conditioned, which was very nice for us spoiled Americans after a hot day of walking the city. Our room was on the 4th floor (really 5th), and going up and down all the stairs did get old after a few days. The elevator is nice when you have luggage, but tiny and slow and not really for use otherwise. Our room (44) was one of the smaller rooms that overlooks the street. About on par with most European rooms I have seen. Everything in the room was very clean and tidy and it had both a small tv (which we didn't use) and a mini-bar hidden under the desk. The only real complaint about the room was the shower. The curtain in the shower was very thin and therefore subjected us to "windy curtain" - when the curtain blows into the shower and ends up sticking to your body. Also, the hand-held shower head would not stay put and we always ended up getting water on the floor despite our best attempts to control it. Other than that, the room was quiet and comfortable. The location of Hotel Monge is great. The Latin Quarter was a fun place to walk around and feels a lot more like a real "neighborhood" than many areas of Paris. The only downfall to the authenticity is that often in shops and stores, no one spoke English and our limited French was stretched to the max. Though this is to be expected in France, in most other parts of the city we did not have this problem. Our experience with the service was mixed. Julie and the other 2 gentlemen working the front desk were nice enough, if not overly helpful. The only time we really utilized their advice was to ask Julie to recommend a cabaret, and unfortunately the one she said was "the best" - LIDO - was TERRIBLE. We were literally laughing in the middle of the "Cat's" montage because it was so cheesy and horrible. We wasted 100 euro on a show straight from 1970. Maybe that's what most tourists want to see, but we were extremely disappointed. A bit of advice: If upon arrival in Paris you choose to take the metro to the hotel, opt for the Cardinal Lemoine stop rather than Place Monge, as there are MULTIPLE stairs to drag your luggage up at Place Monge. For future metro trips, Place Monge is the closer stop (if you head toward the "Arenes de Lutece" exit) - literally a few doors down from the hotel. We made the mistake when we arrived and kicked ourselves later. Some other Metro advice is that if you plan to be in Paris for more than 3-4 days and arrive on a Sunday (or early in the week) you should opt for the "carte l'orange" which has unlimited metro trips for a week. It says you need a picture when you get it (which we paid 4 euro for) but not once was this picture ever verified so I would say skip the photo and plead ignorance if there's ever a problem. Enjoy Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay with Julie and Co. at Hotel Monge!”
Reviews.Author: bicentennial_baby
Reviews.Content: Just spent 6 nights at Hotel Monge, and it was great! After being in another hotel for 2 weeks where my room was only cleaned once in 2 weeks, my move to Hotel Monge was a refreshing change! The room was small, but very clean, and cleaned every morning that I was there. Good shower! From my 7th floor room facing the street, I had a lovely view of Notre Dame's towers, and I enjoyed my little balcony very much! As other's have said, the hotel is a stone's throw from 2 Metro stops, as well as a quick 10 min. walk from Blvd. St. Germain. If you like tv, they have BBC World, as well as a selection of French channels, and Mtv Germany. Julie was wonderful, very pleasant and helpful. My shuttle to the airport two days ago was arranged quickly and with no problems. Next time I'm in Paris, I will definitely stay at Hotel Monge. :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful find in Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Manchego
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem! I was traveling alone and found Hotel Residence Monge on Trip Advisor. It was perfect! The location is great and the rooms are SO clean!!! Be aware that the rooms are on the small side, but everything is spotless. In addition to the wonderful rooms and atmosphere, the staff is great. Julie, the woman who works at the front desk everyday, actually let me speak French! (She also speaks English very well like everyone else in Paris.) I would return to Hotel Residence Monge in a heartbeat alone or with company!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Great Price”
Reviews.Author: MichaeloftheNorth
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to Paris, my third stay at Hotel Residence Monge and my first review of this hotel. It's wonderfully located in the 6th District and minutes away from Notre-Dame, the Seine River and Rue Mouffetard with dozens of great shops and cafes. Their are two Metro stations (Cardinal Lemoine and Place Monge) steps away from the hotel, so it's easy getting to other parts of the city. Although located on a major street the double glazed windows do keep all the traffic noise out, but it’s not too busy of a street to be concerned about. Most traffic is tiny French cars off to work in the morning as most Parisians walk or take a scooter to work. Do not order the breakfasts at the hotel – it caters more to silly Americans who come to Paris to eat at McDonalds. There are great bakeries all around the hotel, so bring something back to your room or go out to eat. It will be cheaper too. Rue Mouffetard is where we had coffee and croissants each morning for breakfast. There is a great outdoor market three days a week outside the main entrance to Metro Place Monge - ask the Hotel Desk for the dates. The hotel rooms are tiny, towels are rough and scratchy and elevator a bit closterphobic. But the bed linens are clean, the bathroom spotless and there is enough room for you to put down all your shopping bags from a day of shopping. Julie the woman working at the desk (I believe she is the owner/manager) is a bit cold at first contact, but she does a wonderful job keeping the riff raff away, making any reservations upon request and giving you detailed directions to any part of the city. So when in Paris it’s more important to spend more money on your meals, clothes and entertaining. This hotel is a great deal. Enjoy Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, Clean, great service”
Reviews.Author: htc001
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very cute! The staff is nice and helpful. Our room has nice, coordinated decor, plenty of curved shelves, a good-sized closet, a spacious bathroom with a big bathtub, remote-controlled air conditioning, a cute balcony, and a minibar/refridgerator. It's also very clean! The hotel itself has a nice lobby with a cute painted elevator that matches the decor of the lobby. It's located near the Monge metro station. We didn't have any prior knowlege of this hotel. We just happened to discover it at 1:30am while desperately looking for a nice hotel so we get get out of our hostel, which is a major dump and has the worst service ever! Young and Happy Hostel is a dumphole and has EXTREMELY bad service!!! I can go on and on about it, but I'll save it for another review. My sister and I are both so glad that we found Hotel Monge, for a decent price. We paid 90 Euro per night for 3 nights. All the other places were either booked are over 120 Euro. We couldn't wait to get out of that yucky hostel the next morning so we checked in early. The staff at Hotel Monge let us keep our luggage in their storage. We came back later that night to find that they had brought our luggages up to our room for us. Such a pleasant little hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “close to metro”
Reviews.Author: desieurojunkie
Reviews.Content: Small hotel located less than a block away from the metro. Friendly staff;Well run by the proprietress. Tiniest elevator I ever saw! we esp liked our room which faced the amphitheater at the back (we paid a few euros more but it was worth it). pricey breakfast not worth the cost. Lots of eateries closeby.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was clean, clean, clean.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at Hotel Monge this past November. Seeing all the rave reviews on this site from others, we had pretty high expectations. On arrival, all expectations were met. Everything was clean, clean, clean. A great little hotel for a great value. For comparison, we stayed as Hotel des Arenes right next door on our last day (due to scheduling problems). They charged a slightly cheaper rate than Hotel Monge (they openly criticized Julie for charging "so much for a two-star") but the place was a dump. The guy at the front desk (Mr. Sallah) was sleazy-cheesy. We're sticking with Hotel Residence Monge next time.

Reviews.Title: “A good visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel to stay at. It was centrally located, the breakfast was good and the rooms were comfortable. One of the best parts was the park behind the hotel where we enjoyed watching kids play and enjoyed french dessert on a sunny afternoon. We would defintly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at residence Monge very much. The staff were very helpful and friendly and recommended a wonderful french resturant very close by. Magnificent food and not too expensive. The rooms are lovely our only complaint would be the noisy water pipes occasionally but that may have only been our room. The location was great...very close to the railway station Monge and very safe area. Would MOST DEFINITELY stay there again and recommend it to our friends. Lovely little bakery just down the street for bfast or lunch. Try the eclairs!! Jo and John,Hurstbridge, Melb, Australia

Reviews.Title: “A Terrific Experience”
Reviews.Author: Riverdaleroamer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Residence Monge in May 2005, a friendly, spotlessly clean, two star hotel on Rue Monge that is perfect for anyone who wants a small tourist hotel at excellent value. We had a very pleasant room facing the Roman arena behind the hotel and one of the great pleasures of our stay was looking out the window onto trees and listening to the birds - very quiet and peaceful. The room (#31) was large by Paris standards with two small beds, a wardrobe and dresser as well as a small alcove with a large chair and a place to put luggage. The bathroom was simple (bring your own facecloth) but perfectly adequate and extremely clean. The continental breakfast was reasonable (6,50E) and an excellent start to the morning. We were only a block from the Rue de Mouffetard and Place Contrascarpe while Luxembourg Gardens, Pantheon, St. Michel and Notre Dame were all within easy walking distance. We used the metro (Place Monge stop is 50 metres from the hotel) to get to other sights. The value, at 109E per night was unbeatable. Many of the guests were regulars, and we'll be back to join them next time we're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: CRclueless
Reviews.Content: This was my second time in Paris so I already knew I wanted to stay in the Latin Quarter...it's young, lively, and there are lots of restaurants and shops. My boyfriend and I went for 4 days. This hotel was the perfect location...a block from one of the main strips of nightlife, but enough distance that noise was not an issue. It was also only a couple blocks from 2 metro stops which was very convenient and easy walking to some major sites like Notre Dame and Saint Chapelle. The room was nothing close to fancy, but very clean and well maintained each day. It was nice to come back to after walking around all day but nothing I'd want to spend anytime in, which was fine for a trip to Paris. For the price though (~$100/night), it was just what I was looking for and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Two magic days at the Hotel Residence Monge.”
Reviews.Author: networker
Reviews.Content: My husband & I are just back from Paris, having spent two wonderful April days at L'Hotel Residence Monge, 55, Rue Monge, Paris 5. I booked the room in January by email (www.hotel-monge@wanadoo.fr)directly with the hotel. It was terrific value at 100 euro per night. We asked for a room at the back overlooking the Arenes De Lutece & were given a room meant for three people on the fourth floor. We had a lovely view from our window & woke to wonderful bird song each morning. The room was spotless,pleasantly decorated, warm & comfortable & our ensuite bathroom was spacious & sparkling clean with white, soft, fluffy towels. The only drawback would be for people who like to have a good shower because the shower was only a handheld one over the bath. Perhaps one could specify if a shower was needed instead of a bath. We asked Madame Julie for two extra pillows & were given them immediatly with a friendly smile. We found Julie to be most professional & helpful. We only had to go to the desk to ask about anything we needed to know and we were given the information straight away, always with a pleasant, friendly attitude. I spoke French to her but I noticed that her English was excellent. She even helped us to carry our bags out to the taxi when we were leaving! We had breakfast in the hotel on both mornings, yoghurt, fruit & cheese as well as croissants and warm bread. My husband is coeliac & needs to eat glutenfree bread, which we were able to buy in a Naturalia shop across the road.The "patron" who serves breakfast, heated it in the oven for him each morning. There are two metro stations very closeby & the Rue Mouffetard, full of atmosphere & good restaurants is just round the corner. The Institut Du Monde Arabe, from the nineth floor of which you can see practically all of Paris(for free unless you want to sit at a rooftop table & have a coffee) is a very short walking distance away. I can't wait to return to Paris, for a longer stay next time & I will definitely stay at L'hotel Residence Monge.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed my stay at the Monge”
Reviews.Author: unhitchedtrailers
Reviews.Content: Based on the glowing reviews of the hotel on this website, I booked a single room for 5 nights in late March. I was not disappointed. I had a room on the top floor facing the street. Although small by American standards, the room was spotless, had a huge & comfy bed, and--a real bonus for a first-time visitor to Paris--a small balcony. Julie at the front desk was very pleasant; her English is perfect and her memory even better! The room also had the added advantage of a small fridge, so I could stock up on water and snacks from the grocery store just up the street on Rue Monge. Add its proximity to rue Mouffetard, two nearby metro stops, and several fine cafes and you have one hell of a bargain for 75 euro a night!

Reviews.Title: “A bit over-rated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed a week in March 2005. The two pros of the hotel is the location (30m from the far-end-gate of the Place Monge metro station) and that it was clean. The cons were that the room we spent the first 4 nights was the smallest I've ever seen at a hotel (3m X 2,50m) so that 2 persons could not move around at the same time (the one should be sitting on the bed) with an equally tiny shower-WC (2m X 1m). The second room we were moved for the rest of our stay was a little better (because it was for 3 persons actually), overlooking an old arena wich was prettier than the street view we had before. The above mentioned along with the worn towels, a cigarette-burn hole on the bed cover and the chiped bath-tub enamel, gave us the impression that we were paying much more than we should have (€97 without breakfast). Finally, the breakfast we paid an extra €8 per person, was poor compared to the one our friends in another 2 star hotel were having at the same period. Overall, I think the reviews that I read before the trip, in order to book the hotel, overstated the positive sides (qualitywise).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a room with a view of the Arenes, for just 84 euros. It was one of the larger rooms we've had in this price range and had good light during the day. Plenty of storage and a spacious, bright bathroom. The most exciting thing about it for me, though, was the view. I had chills down my spine whenever I looked out at the old Roman Arena. The neighborhood, while not my favorite in Paris, has lots of amenities. You're close to Place Contrescarpe and the rue Mouffetard market, as well as the Place Monge and Place Maubert markets. There are a few cute shops in the quartier, but mostly, this is where workaday Paris meets tourist Paris. The staff is accomodating, but we did have a slight problem. We had used American Express to reserve the room, but it turns out that the Hotel does not accept Am Ex as payment! So we had to do some quick thinking to figure out which other credit card we could use (we had done quite a bit of shopping and run up the Visa a bit during our stay). It all worked out okay, but I think they should have notified us when they confirmed the reservation that Am Ex would not be accepted at check out (or why even accept it at all at the confirmation stage?).

Reviews.Title: “Residence Monge perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family (my wife, myself, and our 7-month old son) stayed at Hotel Residence Monge for 4 days in February and absolutely loved it. The hotel was very clean, the linens were fresh everyday (which is not a guarantee in Paris hotels in the 100 euro range), the staff was exceptionally helpful and friendly, and the location was perfect. Our room overlooked the Arenes de Lutece (the hotel is literally next to the arena itself), and we were able to walk to Rue Mouffetard for dinner late in the evening. The hotel is not located in a touristy area, so it was quiet and a nice, comfortable walk to the tourist sections of the Latin Quarter. There are a couple of phenominal patisseries right near the hotel, and a good breton-style creperie across the street. There was also a small cafe (very friendly) across the street that offered excellent cafe creme and a croissant for 2e 50, which is how we started our day. From the hotel there are two Metro stations very close by (Place Monge and Cardinal Lemoine), so getting around by Metro is easy. The hotel is also close to the Place Monge public market, which was a nice taste of real Parisian life. The room was decent-sized, and the bathroom was actually quite spacious for a Paris hotel - we had a full-sized tub with a shower wand, which was quite ample for us. The room was not particularly charming, but it was clean and comfortable, which is exactly what we expected for the price. The price quoted was the price we paid at checkout, and we were extremely satisfied. The only downside was the walls were a bit thin, but nothing unusual for a Paris hotel. Would definitely recommend if you are looking for a good place to land in the evenings that is safe, clean, quiet, and comfortable. A great launching point to enjoy the incredible city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price and Location”
Reviews.Author: shandy40
Reviews.Content: We spent nearly a week in this and chose it based on previous reviews I had read on this site. Have to agree with other reviewers that this hotel is good value for its price and was also happy with its location. The Metro was very close and the Quartier Latin around the corner and still within walking distance of the Marais or St. Germain. Our room was small as we had expected but was well furnished and everything was very clean. The second room we had for our three children was bigger and had a full size bathroom with bathtub. Both rooms had small balconies overlooking the street. It is perhaps worth considering paying a little bit extra for a larger room, especially as the price for the hotel is very reasonable anyway. There were bar fridges and I noticed that they had what appeared to be good air conditioning units in both room, being winter it wasn't necessary to try them out. The only thing I was disappointed in us was the "friendliness" aspect. One of the main reasons I chose this hotel over others was the number of reviews which commented on how friendly the staff were. During the week we were there, the woman at the front desk whom I believe was the owner or at least manager, was courteous but hardly friendly. We never saw her smile once. She was helpful if asked something but we felt as though we were imposing on her when we did ask a question. This was the only place we stayed at during this holiday (having stayed at over 12 different places) where we didn't feel particularly welcome. Regardless of this, I would still recommend the hotel for its price and position.

Reviews.Title: “Great service staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this nice little hotel over the New Years holiday. It was in a pretty good location close to the metro, and the price was excellent for Paris. You can walk about 10 minutes and be on St. Germaine blvd where it's quite lively. The hotel is quaint and clean, and the lady at the front desk is a sweetie. The entire staff was very polite and pleasant. The cleaning lady even brought me tea when I was sick with food poisoning! (not from the hotel) It was really nice to get good service in Paris when a lot of the customer service people in Paris were really rude (like at LV). The hotel staff really made my stay more pleasant. In terms of the room, it's small, but the bed was good size. The pillows were also kind of flat for me. We had a room with just the showering stall and not the full tub. If you are not small sized, I would recommend you get the bathroom with the tub. The elevator is also tiny. If you have luggage, push the luggage in first and then go in yourself, as we've learned. It fits about 3 people no luggage, or one person with big luggage. The nice thing was that there was a fridge, and we were able to get fresh cheeses and butter, to go with the fresh bagettes from the neighborhood. All in all, it was a pleasant little hotel in a safe and authentic part of Paris at a good price. Definately would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint”
Reviews.Author: velureroholt
Reviews.Content: Pros: -Value for money -Friendly and helpful staff -Clean -Located in the Latin Quarter -Not too noisy from the street, and could only hear noise from the hall way, not other rooms. -Decent area for runners and the University nearby has a fitness facility for a fee. Cons: -Small room and tiny shower -No electric kettle in room.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monge - we now know a lovely little hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from our weekend in Paris, and were really pleased with the Hotel Monge. The staff are pleasant and efficient - we didn't see much of them as everything was fine! Our room was spotlessly clean, warm, and comfortable, and tastefully decorated. It overlooked a busy street, but the double glazing eliminated most of the street noise. You pay 6.50 euros extra for the breakfast, and although you might get your cafe and croissant slightly cheaper in the local cafes, if breakfast is a must, we would recommend that you have breakfast at the hotel. The hotel is in a nice part of Paris, within walking distance of the Quartier Latin and the Ile de la Cite, but not overrun with tourists - on the Sunday morning you got the feeling that it was somewhere people lived. There are lots of good restaurants on the rue Mouffetard, just a few minutes walk from the hotel, so you do not need to go on a long trek to find your evening meal when you are already tired from a day's sightseeing. Next time we go to Paris, we will probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Room and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hotel Monge for 3 days and nights in late November 2004. We had 2 street facing rooms which were priced at an excellent rate. The rooms were lovely, spacious and very clean. In our double room, we had an large bathroom with a giant soaking tub, fabulous for a hot bath at the end of a long day on your feet. We did not have breakfast at the hotel but instead frequented the many bakeries and cafes up and down the street. The lift was small but fine for moving luggage. One plus was the small fridge in each room which was great for storing drinks and snacks. The street traffic was noisy but tolerable when windows were kept sealed, I would request a rear facing room in warmer weather if you want to keep the windows open. Our only problem was with guests smoking in the halls, on 2 nights we had to stuff towels around the door to keep the smell of smoke out of the room. I would recommend this hotel for the value and extremely clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Gem!”
Reviews.Author: SamsaraCambridge
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Residence Monge for 4 nights at the end of November, just returned home last night. I booked about 2 weeks before my trip via email based on an article in the New York Times, reviews from this site, and a recommendation from another hotel, and it was a superb experience. Our double room was spotlessly clean, and the bathroom had an attached bath with a hand shower. The sheets were changed daily, and the bed was firm and comfortable. The staff the front desk spoke English (if that is a consideration for you), were polite, helpful, and kind. And best of all, the location is unbeatable, right in the heart of the Left Bank on rue Monge, which is a wonderful street. I made friends with the woman who runs Arene's cafe (two minutes away) on the way to the Cardinal Lemoine Metro. There are boulangeries, a grocery store, and restaurants (try the Vietnamese place up the street on 80 rue Monge for a delicious, cheap meal frequented by locals and students). And the Metro is a heart beat away. You can also walk to the Pantheon, the Institute du monde Arabe, the Paris Mosque (which has an incredible Moroccan/Tunisian restaurant, our best meal in Paris), Notre Dame, Odean, the list is endless. Stay at this place. I will definitely return there. Great value for money, and a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have said, this is a friendly, very clean, conveniently located - i could see the towers of Notre Dame from my 6th floor room - excellent value hotel. The rooms are smallish, if you are a bit wide you may struggle with the showers - i am over 6ft tall but skinny and had no problem - and the lift can only really take two people at a time. the air conditioning made a big difference - the day time temperature was over 30C. I would very happily return - at this price it really is excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monge in June 2004. It was every bit as good as the previous reviewers have said. We have two more details regarding location that we think are important. First, the Monge backs on to the Arenes de Lutece, an ancient Roman arena that was uncovered in the middle of the 19th century and was almost paved over for a bus station. Instead, thanks to neighborhood protesters, it was excavated and turned into a local gathering place. If you pay a few euros extra and have a room in the back, you can watch people playing boules or soccer, or a bunch of decorous young people enjoying an early-evening get-together with wine and snacks. Or you can go downstairs and wander around the beautiful gardens on the upper level, or simply sit on one of the arena steps or a garden bench and read the newspaper. Of course, you can watch the boules and soccer players without paying extra, and I wouldn't be surprised if you could join them. Second, if you walk not toward Mouffetard but in the other direction, you soon come to the Jardin des Plantes. This is not only an entrancing botanical garden but the site of the excellent Museum of Natural History (and other scientific establishments). Just before you arrive at the Jardin des Plantes, you come to the mosque, which has a restaurant and tea-house with marvelous food and North African pastries.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: mannyr8
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few days in April and had a wonderful stay. Julie was super helpful and made us feel very welcome. She is a tireless worker! We had two rooms for a family of four - 2 adults and 2 children - 10 and 13 years old but received a discount. The location was great, just 10 minutes from Notre Dame and many restaurants and stores. Definitely would stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Acte V
HotelInfo.Address: 55, rue Monge | 05 Arr., 75005 Paris, France
